name: Roscoe Arbuckle
quote: A tremendous man skipped up the steps as lightly as Fred Astaire. 'Name's Arbuckle,' he said, 'Roscoe Arbuckle. Call me Fatty! I'm a funnyman and an acrobat.'
description: an American silent film actor, comedian, director, and screenwriter. He mentored Charlie Chaplin and discovered Buster Keaton and Bob Hope. Arbuckle was one of the most popular silent stars of the 1910s, and soon became one of the highest paid actors in Hollywood.

name: Richard Barthelmess
quote: His face was the most beautiful of any man who had ever been before the camera.
description: an American film actor, principally of the Hollywood silent era. He starred opposite Lillian Gish in D.W. Griffith's Broken Blossoms (1919) and Way Down East (1920) and was among the founders of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences in 1927.

name: Irving Berlin
quote: Irving Berlin has no place in American music, he is American music.
description: an American composer and lyricist, widely considered one of the greatest songwriters in American history. His music forms a great part of the Great American Songbook. He wrote hundreds of songs, many becoming major hits, which made him a legend before he turned thirty.

name: Eubie Blake
quote: Eubie will always remain among the finest popular composers and songwriters of his era.
description: an American composer, lyricist, and pianist of ragtime, jazz, and popular music. In 1921, he and his long-time collaborator Noble Sissle wrote Shuffle Along, one of the first Broadway musicals to be written and directed by African Americans.

name: Enrico Caruso
quote: When you speak of tenors, you have to divide them into two groups. Caruso in the first group. All the others are in the second.
description: an Italian operatic tenor. He sang to great acclaim at the major opera houses of Europe and the Americas, appearing in a wide variety of roles from the Italian and French repertoires that ranged from the lyric to the dramatic.

name: Charlie Chaplin
quote: The only person to have gone down into cinematic history without any shadow of a doubt. The films he left behind can never grow old.
description: an English comic actor, filmmaker, and composer who rose to fame in the era of silent film. Chaplin became a worldwide icon through his screen persona ‘the Tramp’ and is considered one of the most important figures in the history of the film industry.

name: Lon Chaney
quote: He was someone who acted out our psyches. He somehow got into the shadows inside our bodies, he was able to nail down some of our secret fears and put them on-screen.
description: an American stage and film actor, make-up artist, director and screenwriter. He is regarded as one of the most versatile and powerful actors of early cinema, renowned for his characterizations of tortured, grotesque characters, and his groundbreaking artistry with makeup.

name: Cecil B. DeMille
quote: There has appeared only one Cecil B. DeMille. He is one of the most extraordinarily able showmen of modern times.
description: an American filmmaker. He is acknowledged as a founding father of the cinema of the United States and the most commercially successful producer-director in film history. His films were distinguished by their epic scale and by his cinematic showmanship.

name: Douglas Fairbanks
quote: It was all fun for him. He wasn't an actor at all. To me, he was an effect, he was a wonderful effect.
description: an American actor, screenwriter, director, and producer. He was best known for his swashbuckling roles in silent films including The Thief of Bagdad, Robin Hood, and The Mark of Zorro but spent the early part of his career making comedies.

name: David Wark Griffith
quote: I have never really hated Hollywood except for its treatment of D. W. Griffith. No town, no industry, no profession, no art form owes so much to a single man.
description: an American director, writer, and producer who pioneered modern filmmaking techniques. Griffith is best remembered for The Birth of a Nation (1915) and Intolerance (1916). Griffith is widely considered among the most important figures in the history of cinema.

name: Harry Houdini
quote: Several reporters tried to capture the charming effect, describing him as 'pleasant-faced', 'the young Hungarian magician with the pleasant smile and easy confidence'.
description: an Austro-Hungarian-born American stage magician and stunt performer, noted for his sensational escape acts. Houdini made several movies, but quit acting when it failed to bring in money. He was also a keen aviator, and aimed to become the first man to fly a plane in Australia.

name: Al Jolson
quote: Zelda Fitzgerald... leaned forward and said to me, telling me her great secret, 'Ernest, don't you think Al Jolson is greater than Jesus?'
description: an American singer, film actor, and comedian. At the peak of his career, he was dubbed ‘The World's Greatest Entertainer.’ His performing style was brash and extroverted, and he popularized a large number of songs that benefited from his ‘shamelessly sentimental approach.’

name: Buster Keaton
quote: Buster plainly is a man inclined towards a belief in nothing but mathematics and absurdity. Look at his face, as beautiful but as inhuman as a butterfly, and you see that utter failure to identify sentiment.
description: an American actor, comedian, film director, producer, screenwriter, and stunt performer. He was best known for his silent films, in which his trademark was physical comedy with a consistently stoic, deadpan expression, earning him the nickname ‘The Great Stone Face.’

name: Jerome Kern
quote: The first time Jerry played that melody for me, I went out and started to cry. The release absolutely killed me. I couldn't stop. It was so beautiful.
description: an American composer of musical theatre and popular music. One of the most important American theatre composers of the early 20th century ( ‘Ol' Man River’, ‘The Way You Look Tonight’, ‘Long Ago (and Far Away)’ , ‘Who?’).

name: Harold Lloyd
quote: Laughter is the universal language. It establishes a common identity among people, regardless of other differences. It is the sweetest sound in the whole world.
description: an American actor, comedian, director, producer, screenwriter, and stunt performer who is best known for his silent comedy films. Lloyd ranks alongside Charlie Chaplin and Buster Keaton as one of the most popular and influential film comedians of the silent film era.

name: Oscar Micheaux
quote: The most successful African-American filmmaker of the first half of the 20th century.
description: an African American author, film director and independent producer. Micheaux is regarded as the first major African-American feature filmmaker and has been described as ‘the most successful African-American filmmaker of the first half of the 20th century’.

name: Jack Pickford
quote: All American boy next door.
description: a Canadian-born American actor, film director and producer. He was the younger brother of actresses Mary and Lottie Pickford. Jack also appeared in numerous films as the "All American boy next door" and was a fairly popular performer.

name: Mack Sennett
quote: I think Sennett is the greatest pick of talent there's ever been in the motion picture business.
description: a Canadian-born American director and actor and was known as an innovator of slapstick comedy in film. During his lifetime he was known at times as the ‘King of Comedy’.

name: Bert Williams
quote: The funniest man I ever saw - and the saddest man I ever knew.
description: a Bahamian American entertainer, one of the pre-eminent entertainers of the Vaudeville era and one of the most popular comedians for all audiences of his time. He was by far the best-selling black recording artist before 1920.

name: P.G. Wodehouse
quote: It is now abundantly clear that Wodehouse is one of the funniest and most productive men who ever wrote in English.
description: an English author and one of the most widely read humorists of the 20th century. During and after the World War I, together with Guy Bolton and Jerome Kern, he wrote a series of Broadway musical comedies that were an important part of the development of the American musical.

name: Albert Einstein
quote: Einstein is a favorite model for depictions of mad scientists and absent-minded professors, 'a cartoonist's dream come true’.
description: a German-born theoretical physicist. Einstein developed the theory of relativity, one of the two pillars of modern physics (alongside quantum mechanics). Einstein's intellectual achievements and originality have made the word ‘Einstein’ synonymous with ‘genius’.

name: William Surrey Hart
quote: Though Hart could be cast as a villain, he imbued all of his characters with honor and integrity.
description: an American silent film actor, screenwriter, director and producer. He is remembered as a foremost western star of the silent era who ‘imbued all of his characters with honor and integrity.’

name: Tom Mix
quote: Mix was the acknowledged 'King of Cowboys' when Ronald Reagan and John Wayne were young.
description: an American film actor and the star of many early Western movies between 1909 and 1935. Mix appeared in 291 films, all but nine of which were silent movies. He was Hollywood's first Western star and helped define the genre as it emerged in the early days of the cinema.

name: Ramon Novarro
quote: I was always the hero - with no vices - reciting practically the same lines to the leading lady.
description: a Mexican film, stage and television actor who began his career in silent films and eventually became a leading man of the 1920s and early 1930s. Novarro was promoted by MGM as a ‘Latin lover’ and became known as a sex symbol after the death of Rudolph Valentino.

name: Rudolph Valentino
quote: Here was a young man who was living daily the dream of millions of other men. Here was one who was catnip to women. Here was one who had wealth and fame. And here was one who was very unhappy.
description: an Italian naturalized American actor who starred in several well-known silent films. He was an early pop icon, a sex symbol of the 1920s, who was known as the ‘Latin lover’ or simply as ‘Valentino’. His death at 31 further propelled him to iconic status.

name: Jimmie Rodgers
quote: His songs were different than the norm. They had more of an individual nature and an elevated conscience... I was drawn to their power.
description: an American country, blues and folk singer, songwriter and musician in the early 20th century, known most widely for his rhythmic yodeling. Rodgers, along with his contemporaries the Carter Family, was among one of the first country music superstars and pioneers.

name: Fritz Lang
quote: Over and over, Lang made movies about the madness of crowds, the indelible stain of guilt, the influence of the powerful, and yes, the way people look beneath their clothes - literally and metaphorically.
description: an Austrian-German-American filmmaker, screenwriter, and occasional film producer and actor. One of the best-known émigrés from Germany's school of Expressionism, he was dubbed the ‘Master of Darkness’ by the British Film Institute.

name: Max Ernst
quote: Max Ernst is above all an artist in the limited sense-a man who paints with taste and sensibility. He used these gifts to convey his vision-his symbolic vision-just as Blake used his poetic sensibility to convey his symbolic vision.
description: a German painter, sculptor, graphic artist, and poet. A prolific artist, Ernst was a primary pioneer of the Dada movement and Surrealism.

name: Andre Breton
quote: The founder of surrealism who frequently dresses entirely in green, smokes a green pipe, drinks a green liqueur and has a sound of knowledge of Freudian psychology.
description: a French writer, poet, and anti-fascist. He is known best as the founder of Surrealism. His writings include the first Surrealist Manifesto (Manifeste du surréalisme) of 1924, in which he defined surrealism as ‘pure psychic automatism’.

name: F. Scott Fitzgerald
quote: His talent was as natural as the pattern that was made by the dust on a butterfly's wings.
description: an American novelist and short story writer, whose works (The Beautiful and Damned, The Great Gatsby) illustrate the Jazz Age. While he achieved limited success in his lifetime, he is now widely regarded as one of the greatest American writers of the 20th century.

name: Ernest Hemingway
quote: Hemingway left stories and novels so starkly moving that some have become part of our cultural heritage.
description: an American novelist, short story writer, and journalist. His economical and understated style had a strong influence on 20th-century fiction, while his life of adventure and his public image influenced later generations.

name: Alexander Fleming
quote: One sometimes finds what one is not looking for. When I woke up just after dawn on Sept. 28, 1928, I certainly didn't plan to revolutionize all medicine by discovering the world's first antibiotic, or bacteria killer. But I guess that was exactly what I did.
description: a Scottish physician, microbiologist, and pharmacologist. His best-known discoveries are the enzyme lysozyme in 1923 and the world's first antibiotic substance benzylpenicillin for which he shared the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine in 1945.

name: Thomas Stearns Eliot
quote: Order - that is what makes Mr Eliot's critical work so precious to us today. He has imposed an order on our chaos, our intellectual anarchy, he throws us a plank as we drown in a sea of platitudes and foaming stupidities.
description: a British essayist, publisher, playwright, literary and social critic, and ‘one of the twentieth century's major poets’. Eliot attracted widespread attention for his poem ‘The Love Song of J. Alfred Prufrock’ (1915), which was seen as a masterpiece of the Modernist movement.

name: John Gilbert
quote: Handsome, romantic lead of silent films, Gilbert reached his peak in the late 1920s starring opposite Greta Garbo in several features.
description: an American actor, screenwriter and director. He rose to fame during the silent film era and became a popular leading man known as ‘The Great Lover’. Gilbert's popularity began to wane when silent pictures gave way to talkies.

name: William Haines
quote: By the end of the 1920s, William Haines was Hollywood's #1 box-office draw - a talented, handsome, and wisecracking romantic lead.
description: an American film actor and interior designer. The role in The Midnight Express solidified his screen persona as a wisecracking, arrogant leading man. Haines quit acting in 1935 due to his refusal to deny his homosexuality and started a successful interior design business.

name: Max Schreck
quote: Whoever hopes to discover a vampire will be disappointed, but they will find an actor of real skill and versatility, yet he himself remains somewhat shrouded in mystery.
description: a German actor, best known for his lead role as the vampire Count Orlok in the film Nosferatu (1922).

name: Stan Laurel
quote: Chaplin wasn't the funniest. I wasn't the funniest. Stan Laurel was the funniest.
description: an English comic actor, writer and film director, who was part of the comedy duo Laurel and Hardy. Laurel began his career in music hall, where he appropriated a number of his standard comic devices: the bowler hat, the deep comic gravity and the nonsensical understatement.

name: Oliver Hardy
quote: His twiddle of the tie and his 'camera look' technique were all there. He had a stubborn attitude and played a know-it-all, who's behavior always got the boys in a mess. That was an unmistakable genius.
description: an American comic actor and one half of Laurel and Hardy, the double act that began in the era of silent films and lasted 25 years. He appeared with his comedy partner Stan Laurel in 107 short films, feature films, and cameo roles.

name: Conrad Veidt
quote: He used his position as an actor from a war-making country to fight for what he believed in - tolerance, justice, compassion - even if it meant espousing on screen exactly the opposite values.
description: a German actor best remembered for his roles in films such as The Cabinet of Dr. Caligari, The Man Who Laughs, and, after being forced to migrate to Britain by the rise of Nazism in Germany, his roles in The Thief of Bagdad, and, in Hollywood, Casablanca.

name: Babe Ruth
quote: He was a superman and yet his legs were spindly. He was a big florid man, yet all his movements were dainty as a squirrel's. He was gentle to children and could be blasphemous to adults. He was Hercules with bat in hand.
description: an American professional baseball player whose career in Major League Baseball spanned 22 seasons, from 1914 through 1935. Ruth is regarded as one of the greatest sports heroes in American culture and is considered by many to be the greatest baseball player of all time.

name: James Stewart
quote: An endearing perfectionist with a droll sense of humor and a shy way of watching you to see if you react to that humor.
description: an American actor and military officer who is among the most honored and popular stars in film history. Stewart was known for his distinctive drawl and down-to-earth persona, which helped him often portray American middle-class men struggling in crisis.

name: Cary Grant
quote: Quite simply, the funniest actor cinema has ever produced.
description: a English-American actor, known as one of classic Hollywood's definitive leading men. He began a career in Hollywood in the early 1930s, and became known for his transatlantic accent, debonair demeanor, and light-hearted approach to acting and sense of comic timing.

name: Henry Fonda
quote: A true professional dedicated to excellence in his craft. He graced the screen with a sincerity and accuracy which made him a legend.
description: an American film and stage actor. Throughout 5 decades in Hollywood, Fonda cultivated a strong, appealing screen image in such classics as The Ox-Bow Incident, Mister Roberts, and 12 Angry Men. Later, Fonda moved both toward darker epics and lighter roles in family comedies.

name: Clark Gable
quote: He was as masculine as any man I've ever known, and as much a little boy as a grown man could be - it was this combination that had such a devastating effect on women.
description: an American film actor and military officer, often referred to as ‘The King of Hollywood’ or just simply as ‘The King’. In 1932, he landed his first leading Hollywood role and over the next three decades he became a leading man in more than 60 motion pictures.

name: Gary Cooper
quote: The personality of this man was so enormous, so overpowering - and that expression in his eyes and his face, it was so delicate and so underplayed. You just didn't notice it until you saw it on the screen.
description: an American film actor known for his natural and understated acting style and screen performances. His career spanned thirty-five years, from 1925 to 1960. The screen persona he sustained throughout his career represented the ideal American hero.

name: James Cagney
quote: Maybe the greatest actor to ever appear in front of a camera.
description: an American actor and dancer, both on stage and in film, though he had his greatest impact in film. Known for his consistently energetic performances, distinctive vocal style, and deadpan comic timing, he won acclaim and major awards for a wide variety of performances.

name: Spencer Tracy
quote: One never had the feeling he was 'acting' in a scene, but the truth of the situation was actually happening, spontaneously, at the moment he spoke his lines.
description: an American actor, noted for his natural style and versatility. His career flourished with a series of hit films, and in 1937 and 1938 he won consecutive Oscars for Captains Courageous and Boys Town. By the 1940s, Tracy was one of the studio's top stars.

name: Errol Flynn
quote: Damn it! The man could act!
description: an Australian-born actor who achieved fame in Hollywood after 1935. He was known for his romantic swashbuckler roles in Hollywood films, as well as frequent partnerships with Olivia de Havilland.

name: Fred Astaire
quote: The history of dance on film begins with Astaire.
description: an American dancer, singer, actor, choreographer and television presenter. He is widely regarded as one of the most influential dancers in the history of film. As a dancer, he is best remembered for his sense of rhythm, perfectionism, and as the dancing partner of Ginger Rogers.

name: Edward G. Robinson
quote: He achieved greatness as a player, a patron of the arts and a dedicated citizen ... in sum, a Renaissance man.
description: a Romanian-born American actor. A popular star on stage and screen during Hollywood's Golden Age, he appeared in more than 100 films. He is best remembered for his tough-guy roles as a gangster, such as his star-making films, Little Caesar and Key Largo.

name: Fredric March
quote: Mr. March struck Hollywood as the answer to a prayer, for not only was he the possessor of a virile and handsome profile that could meet, the most rigorous demands of the camera close-up, but also he had a rich, well-trained stage actor's voice.
description: a distinguished stage actor and one of Hollywood's most celebrated, versatile stars of the 1930s and 40s. He won the Academy Award for Best Actor for Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde (1931) and The Best Years of Our Lives (1946).

name: William Powell
quote: Mr. Powell was noted for his trim mustache, impeccable attire and resonant voice. His face was considered suited more to sinister than romantic roles, and throughout the silent-film era he invariably played cads and other villains.
description: an American actor. A major star at Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, he was paired with Myrna Loy in 14 films, including the Thin Man series based on the Nick and Nora Charles characters created by Dashiell Hammett.

name: Walter Huston
quote: Due to his great talent and his understated style, his reputation has not suffered as has some other of his 'great actor' contemporaries of the 1930s, but rather, seems to have been burnished as time goes by.
description: a Canadian-born American actor and singer. Huston won the Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor for his role in The Treasure of the Sierra Madre, directed by his son John Huston.

name: Leslie Howard
quote: Howard was not what he seemed. He had the kind of distraught air that would make people want to mother him. Actually, he was about as naive as General Motors. Busy little brain, always going.
description: an English stage and film actor, director and producer. Howard also wrote many stories and articles for The New York Times and The New Yorker. Howard was one of the movie idols of the 1930s but is probably best remembered for playing Ashley Wilkes in Gone with the Wind.

name: Fred Allen
quote: A comedian, actor and singer, with a dry, gravelly voice, baggy eyes, and deadpan expression, all of which made him ideal for the kind of topical monologues that became his speciality.
description: an American comedian whose absurdist, topically-pointed radio program The Fred Allen Show made him one of the most popular humorists in the Golden Age of American radio. His best-remembered gag was his long-running mock feud with friend and comedian Jack Benny.

name: Warner Baxter
quote: Armed with a thick Mexican accent and a surfeit of roguish charm, he frequently played womanizing, charismatic Latin bandit types in westerns.
description: an American film actor from the 1910s to the 1940s. Baxter became known for his role as The Cisco Kid in the 1928 film for which he won the Academy Award for Best Actor. He frequently played womanizing, charismatic Latin bandit types in westerns.

name: Wallace Beery
quote: Imposing and not traditionally handsome, Beery was highly proficient at both comedy and menace, sometimes even mixing the two quite superbly.
description: an American film actor. He is best known for his portrayal of Bill in Min and Bill opposite Marie Dressler, as Long John Silver in Treasure Island, and his titular role in The Champ, for which he won the Academy Award for Best Actor.

name: Charles Boyer
quote: A tall, dark and handsome and with his thick French accent and dark piercing eyes on screen, he captured many a female fans heart. He was the last of the cinema's great lovers.
description: a French actor who appeared in more than 80 films between 1920 and 1976. His memorable performances were among the era's most highly praised, in romantic dramas such as The Garden of Allah (1936) and Love Affair (1939), as well as the mystery-thriller Gaslight (1944).

name: Frank Capra
quote: The art of Frank Capra is very, very simple: It's the love of people. Add two simple ideals to this love of people: the freedom of each individual, and the equal importance of each individual, and you have the principle upon which I based all my films.
description: an Italian-American film director, producer and writer. Capra became one of America's most influential directors during the 1930s, among his leading films were It Happened One Night (1934), You Can't Take It With You (1938), and Mr. Smith Goes to Washington (1939).

name: Boris Karloff
quote: The long-reigning king of Hollywood horror.
description: an English actor who was primarily known for his roles in horror films. He portrayed Frankenstein's monster in Frankenstein (1931), Bride of Frankenstein (1935), and Son of Frankenstein (1939), which resulted in his immense popularity.

name: Humphrey Bogart
quote: The cult hero of American cinema, Bogart's screen persona--the tight-lipped, streetwise thug--is a testament to his gifts as an actor, especially when contrasted against his upper crust upbringing.
description: an American screen and stage actor whose performances in 1940s films noir such as The Maltese Falcon, Casablanca, and The Big Sleep earned him status as a cultural icon. The American Film Institute ranked Bogart as the greatest male star of Classic American cinema.

name: Orson Welles
quote: The ultimate auteur', which known for his use of low camera angles, tracking shots, deep focus and elaborate crane shots in his films and which was one of the most recognizable deep voices in all of film, radio or television.
description: an American actor, director, writer, and producer. He is remembered for his innovative work in 3 directions: in theatre, most notably Caesar, in radio, the legendary broadcast The War of the Worlds and in film, Citizen Kane, consistently ranked as one of the greatest films ever made.

name: Gene Kelly
quote: Fred Astaire represented the aristocracy, I represented the proletariat.
description: an American dancer, actor of film, stage, and television, singer, film director, producer, and choreographer. He was known for his energetic and athletic dancing style, his good looks, and the likable characters that he played on screen.

name: Gregory Peck
quote: Gregory Peck seemed to embody the soul of the principled, upright, all-American man in some of his most notable roles. He was an imposing figure with a smooth, deep voice - a perfect match for the silver screen.
description: an American actor who was one of the most popular film stars from the 1940s to the 1960s. His performance as Atticus Finch in the 1962 film To Kill a Mockingbird earned him the Academy Award for Best Actor.

name: Bing Crosby
quote: Bing has a way of singing with his very heart and soul / Which captivates the world / His millions of listeners never fail to rejoice / At his golden voice.
description: an American singer and actor. Crosby's trademark warm bass-baritone voice made him the best-selling recording artist of the 20th century, having sold over one billion records, tapes, compact discs and digital downloads around the world.

name: Montgomery Clift
quote: Montgomery Clift had the most earnest of faces: big, pleading eyes, a set jaw, and the sort of immaculate side part we haven't seen since. He played the desperate, the drunken, and the deceived, and the trajectory of his life was as tragic as that in any of his films.
description: an American film and stage actor. The New York Times obituary of Clift noted his portrayal of ‘moody, sensitive young men’. He is best remembered for roles in Red River (1948), The Heiress (1949), A Place in the Sun (1951), I Confess (1952), From Here to Eternity (1953).

name: Joseph Cotten
quote: There was often a sadness about Joseph Cotten, and it was one of his most attractive qualities as an actor. Tall, handsome, usually dressed with quiet style, he was rarely the man of action, and he got the girl only in his forgotten pictures.
description: an American film, stage, radio and television actor. Cotten achieved prominence on Broadway, in The Philadelphia Story and Sabrina Fair. He first gained worldwide fame in three Orson Welles films: Citizen Kane, The Magnificent Ambersons and Journey into Fear.

name: Walt Disney
quote: He probably did more to heal, or at least soothe troubled human spirits than all the psychiatrists in the world.
description: an American entrepreneur, animator, voice actor and film producer. A pioneer of the American animation industry, he introduced several developments in the production of cartoons. As a producer, Disney holds the record for most Academy Awards earned by an individual – 22.

name: Sydney Greenstreet
quote: Portly English actor with a uniqely insinuating style of line delivery.
description: a British actor who did not work in films until the age of 62, but enjoyed a run of notable hits in a Hollywood career lasting just eight years. He is best remembered for his Warner Bros. films with Humphrey Bogart and Peter Lorre.

name: Alan Ladd
quote: You'd be in despair. You'd go down to the set and you'd say, 'Why are we even making this film?' Then you'd go to the rushes, and there'd be these beautiful eyes, full of hidden thoughts. A marvelous film actor.
description: an American actor and film and television producer. Ladd found success in film in the 1940s and early 1950s, particularly in Westerns such as Shane  and films noir in which he was often paired with Veronica Lake, such as This Gun for Hire (1942) and The Blue Dahlia (1946).

name: Charles Laughton
quote: He was probably the greatest film actor who came from that period of time. He had something quite remarkable. His generosity as an actor, he fed himself into that work. As an actor, you cannot take your eyes off him.
description: an English stage and film actor, director, producer and screenwriter. He played a wide range of classical and modern parts, making an impact in Shakespeare at the Old Vic. He collaborated with Alexander Korda on notable British films, including The Private Life of Henry VIII.

name: Ray Milland
quote: A debonair Welshman whose cool, handsome exterior showcased a wide range of acting abilities.
description: a Welsh actor and film director. He is best remembered for his Oscar-winning portrayal of an alcoholic writer in The Lost Weekend, a sophisticated leading man in Reap the Wild Wind, the murder-plotting husband in Dial M for Murder, and as Oliver Barrett III in Love Story.

name: Dick Powell
quote: A traveling entertainer, TV producer and multifaceted actor, especially adept at portraying tough heroes.
description: an American singer, actor, film producer, film director and studio head. He showed versatility and successfully transformed from musical comedy performer to dramatic actor. He was the first actor to portray the private detective Philip Marlowe on screen.

name: Walter Pidgeon
quote: A handsome, tall and dark-haired man who was able to put his strong, stage-trained voice to good use.
description: a Canadian actor who starred in many films, including How Green Was My Valley, Mrs. Miniver, Forbidden Planet, Advise & Consent. He became a huge star with the arrival of talkies, thanks to his singing voice and starred in many extravagant early Technicolor musicals.

name: Ronald Reagan
quote: I won the nickname the great communicator. But I never thought it was my style that made a difference - it was the content. I wasn't a great communicator, but I communicated great things.
description: an American politician and actor who served as the 40th President of the United States from 1981 to 1989. Before his presidency, he served as the 33rd Governor of California from 1967 to 1975, after a career as a Hollywood actor and union leader.

name: Cesar Romero
quote: To one generation, he was the distinguished Latin lover of numerous musicals and romantic comedies, and the rogue bandit The Cisco Kid. However, to a younger generation weaned on television, Romero was better known as The Joker.
description: an American actor, singer, dancer and vocal artist. His wide range of screen roles included Latin lovers, historical figures in costume dramas, characters in light domestic comedies, and the Joker on the Batman television series.

name: Mickey Rooney
quote: Rooney is not just an actor of genius, but an artist able to maintain a stylized commentary on the demon impulse of the small, belligerent man.
description: an American actor, vaudevillian, comedian, producer and radio personality. At the height of a career, Rooney performed the role of Andy Hardy in a series of 15 films in the 1930s and 1940s that epitomized American family values.

name: Cornel Wilde
quote: Cornel Wilde was a unique specimen. Fluent in several languages and good with accents, he was also highly athletic and often emphasized physicality in his performances.
description: a Hungarian-American actor and film director. By the 1940s he had signed a contract with 20th Century Fox, and by the mid-1940s he was a major leading man. He was nominated for the Academy Award for Best Actor for his performance in 1945's A Song to Remember.

name: Fred MacMurray
quote: Best known for his roles as a father figure and an everyday man, Fred MacMurray was a simple man in the complicated world of Hollywood.
description: an American actor who appeared in more than 100 movies and a successful television series during a career that spanned from 1930 to the 1970s. MacMurray is best known for his role in the 1944 film noir Double Indemnity, in which he starred with Barbara Stanwyck.

name: Louis Prima
quote: A tireless showman and an underrated musical talent, Louis Prima swung his way to icon status thanks to an irresistible, infectious sound whose appeal translated across generations.
description: an Italian American singer, actor, songwriter, bandleader, and trumpeter. At a time when musicians were often discouraged from openly stressing their ethnicity, Prima's conspicuous embrace of his Italian ethnicity opened the doors for other musicians to display their ethnic roots.

name: Harry Belafonte
quote: An important voice of the civil rights movement and one of the first black entertainers to be accepted by mainstream audiences, Harry Belafonte stands as an iconic figure in the American arts.
description: an American singer, songwriter, actor, and social activist. One of the most successful Jamaican-American pop stars in history, he was dubbed the ‘King of Calypso’ for popularizing the Caribbean musical style with an international audience in the 1950s.

name: Marlon Brando
quote: Simply put, in film acting, there is before Brando, and there is after Brando. And they are like different worlds.
description: an American actor, film director and activist. He was widely credited with bringing realism to film acting. Marlon Brando is a cultural icon whose popularity has endured for over six decades. His rise to national attention in the 1950s had a profound effect on American culture.

name: Yul Brynner
quote: Exotic leading man of American films, famed as much for his completely bald head as for his performances, Yul Brynner masked much of his life in mystery and outright lies designed to tease people he considered gullible.
description: a Russian-born film and stage actor. Brynner was best known for his portrayal of King Mongkut of Siam in the Rodgers and Hammerstein musical The King and I, for which he won two Tony Awards and an Academy Award for the film version.

name: Richard Burton
quote: He was a Welsh coal miner's son whose celebrity was defined as much by his rakish personal life as his remarkable acting skills. He offered rugged good looks, a magnetic stage presence and an incomparable voice.
description: a Welsh actor who was noted for his mellifluous baritone voice. Burton established himself as a formidable Shakespearean actor in the 1950s, and he gave a memorable performance of Hamlet in 1964. He was called ‘the natural successor to Olivier’ by Kenneth Tynan.

name: Tony Curtis
quote: God is great, he won't hurt us, 'cause he looks like Tony Curtis.
description: an American film actor whose career spanned six decades but who was mostly popular in the 1950s and early 1960s. By the latter half of the 1950s he became a strong screen presence with the range to act in numerous dramatic and comedy roles.

name: Peter Cushing
quote: Peter was the most gentle man I have ever met, quite enchanting and a meticulous actor.
description: an English actor and a BAFTA TV Award Best Actor winner in 1956. He is mainly known for his prolific appearances in Hammer films, in which he played strong character roles like the sinister scientist Frankenstein, Sherlock Holmes and the vampire hunter Doctor Van Helsing.

name: James Dean
quote: American film actor who was enshrined as a symbol of the confused, restless, and idealistic youth of the 1950s.
description: an American actor. He is remembered as a cultural icon of teenage disillusionment and social estrangement, as expressed in the title of his most celebrated film, Rebel Without a Cause (1955), in which he starred as troubled teenager Jim Stark.

name: Alec Guinness
quote: The outstanding poet of anonymity, Guinness was a consummate performer, effortlessly portraying characters that ranged from eight members of the same family to an aging Jedi master.
description: an English actor. Guinness was one of three British actors, along with Laurence Olivier and John Gielgud, who made the transition from Shakespearean theatre to blockbuster films. He is also known for his portrayal of Obi-Wan Kenobi in original Star Wars trilogy.

name: Jack lemmon
quote: America's Everyman', Lemmon was able always to elicit a laugh or sympathy from his viewers and his charismatic presence always shined on the big screen.
description: an American actor and musician. Lemmon was an eight time Academy Award nominee, with two wins. He starred in over 60 films, such as Some Like It Hot, The Apartment, Mister Roberts, The Odd Couple, Save the Tiger, Missing.

name: Jerry Lewis
quote: I was nine all of my life. Nine is innocent. Nine has a tremendous sense of humor and nine sees everything.
description: an American comedian, actor, singer, producer, director, screenwriter and humanitarian. He was known for his slapstick humor in film, television, stage and radio and was nicknamed the ’King of Comedy’. He and Dean Martin were partners as the hit popular comedy duo.

name: James Mason
quote: His mellifluous voice and an uncanny ability to suggest rampant emotion beneath a face of absolute calm made him a fascinating performer to watch.
description: an English actor. Mason achieved considerable success in British cinema before becoming one of Hollywood's biggest stars. He starred in a number of films , including The Desert Fox, A Star Is Born, Lolita, North by Northwest, A Touch of Larceny, Julius Caesar, Georgy Girl.

name: Yves Montand
quote: The quintessence of worldly Gallic charm.
description: an Italian-French actor and singer. Montand went on to international recognition as a singer and actor, starring in numerous films. His recognizably crooner songs, especially those about Paris, became instant classics.

name: Jack Palance
quote: Jack Palance exemplified evil incarnate on film - portraying some of the most intensely despised villains witnessed in 50s westerns and melodrama.
description: an American actor and singer. Throughout the 1950s Palance earned some very good film roles such as those in Sudden Fear (1952), Shane (1953), Man in the Attic (1953) (his first lead), The Big Knife (1955) and the war classic Attack (1956).

name: Frank Sinatra
quote: The greatest male pop singer in the history of America who seemed to exemplify the common man, an ethnic twentieth-century American male who reached the 'top of the heap', yet never forgot his roots.
description: an American singer, actor, and producer who was one of the most popular and influential musical artists of the 20th century. Having sold more than 150 million records Sinatra also forged a highly successful career as a film actor.

name: Chuck Berry
quote: If you tried to give rock and roll another name, you might call it Chuck Berry.
description: an American singer, songwriter, musician, and one of the pioneers of rock and roll music. Writing lyrics that focused on teen life and consumerism, and developing a music style that included guitar solos and showmanship, Berry was a major influence on subsequent rock music.

name: Elvis Presley
quote: He was the greatest there ever was, is, or ever will be. We did not have the airwaves he had, bet he delivered what he obtained brilliantly.
description: an American singer, musician, and actor. Regarded as one of the most significant cultural icons of the 20th century, he is often referred to as the ‘King of Rock and Roll’ or simply ‘the King’. Presley is one of the most celebrated and influential musicians of the 20th century.

name: Dean Martin
quote: If there had to be an image for cool, the man to fit it would be Dean Martin.
description: an American singer, actor, comedian, and film producer. One of the most popular and enduring American entertainers of the mid-20th century, Martin was nicknamed the ‘King of Cool’ for his seemingly effortless charisma and self-assurance. He was in duo Martin and Lewis.

name: Charlton Heston
quote: With features chiseled in stone, and renowned for playing a long list of historical figures, particularly in Biblical epics, the tall, well built and ruggedly handsome Charlton Heston was one of Hollywood's greatest leading men.
description: an American actor and political activist. As a Hollywood star, he appeared in 100 films, such as The Ten Commandments, Touch of Evil, Ben-Hur, El Cid, and Planet of the Apes (1968). He also starred in the films The Greatest Show on Earth, Secret of the Incas, The Big Country.

name: William Holden
quote: Bill was a complex guy, a totally honorable friend. He was a genuine star. Every woman was in love with him.
description: an American actor who was one of the biggest box-office draws of the 1950s. Holden starred in some of Hollywood's most popular and critically acclaimed films, including such classics as Sunset Boulevard, Sabrina, The Bridge on the River Kwai, The Wild Bunch, and Network.

name: Van Johnson
quote: The embodiment of the boy-next-door wholesomeness that made him a popular Hollywood star in the '40s and '50s,  playing the red-haired, freckle-faced soldier, sailor or bomber pilot who used to live down the street.
description: an American film and television actor and dancer who was a major star at Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer during and after World War II. Johnson starred in such films as Thirty Seconds Over Tokyo, A Guy Named Joe, and The Human Comedy.

name: Clint Eastwood
quote: The roles that Eastwood has played, and the films that he has directed, cannot be disentangled from the nature of the American culture of the last quarter century, its fantasies and its realities.
description: an American actor, filmmaker, musician, and political figure. He rose to international fame with his role as the Man with No Name in Sergio Leone's Dollars Trilogy of Spaghetti Westerns during the 1960s, and as antihero cop Harry Callahan throughout the 1970s and 1980s.

name: John Wayne
quote: The solid icon of rugged masculinity, individuality, and inner strength.
description: an American actor and filmmaker. An Oscar-winner for True Grit (1969), Wayne personified for millions the nation's frontier heritage. 83 of his movies were Westerns, and in them he played cowboys, cavalrymen, and unconquerable loners extracted from the Republic's creation myth.

name: Marcello Mastroianni
quote: An attractive man whose acting style projected a mood of casual affability, he achieved international fame as the screen symbol of the modern European.
description: an Italian film actor. His prominent films include: La Dolce Vita, 8½, La Notte, Divorce Italian Style, Marriage Italian Style, The 10th Victim, A Special Day, City of Women, Henry IV, Dark Eyes and Stanno tutti bene.

name: Alain Delon
quote: The magnetic Alain Delon was among the most prominent French actors of the postwar era: an exotically handsome performer, he sprung from offscreen rumor and scandal to emerge as a uniquely enigmatic and sinister talent.
description: a French actor and businessman. Delon became one of Europe's most prominent actors and screen sex symbols in the 1960s. He achieved critical acclaim for roles in films such as Rocco and His Brothers, Purple Noon, L'Eclisse, Lost Command and Le Samourai.

name: Jean-Paul Belmondo
quote: His laconic, tough guy persona, expressive, unconventional looks, and considerable onscreen charm have made him an icon of French cinema.
description: a French actor initially associated with the New Wave of the 1960s and one of the biggest French film stars of the 1960s, 1970s and 1980s. His best known credits include Breathless (1960) and That Man from Rio (1964).

name: Paul Newman
quote: He makes it look so easy, and he looks so wonderful, that everybody assumes he isn't acting.
description: an American actor, voice actor, film director, producer, race car driver, entrepreneur, philanthropist, and activist. Newman's roles include the title characters in The Hustler, Hud, Harper and Cool Hand Luke, Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid, The Sting, and The Color of Money.

name: Sidney Poitier
quote: Sidney Poitier changed the face of cinema by portraying characters who were complex, dignified, self-assured, and African American.
description: a Bahamian American actor, film director, author and diplomat. In 1964, Poitier became the first Bahamian and first black actor to win an Academy Award for Best Actor, for his role in Lilies of the Field.

name: Peter O'Toole
quote: Peter O'Toole was known as an actor with baby blue eyes, striking good looks and velvety, deep voice,whose performance in the 1962 epic film ‘Lawrence of Arabia’ established him as one of his generation's most charismatic actor.
description: an Anglo-Irish stage and film actor. He achieved international recognition playing in Lawrence of Arabia and received his first nomination for the Oscar. He was nominated for this award another 7 times and holds the record for the most Oscar nominations for acting without a win.

name: Sean Connery
quote: Sly, sexy and confident with questionable scruples, Connery as Bond was the embodiment of the British secret agent to many.
description: a Scottish actor and producer who has won an Academy Award, two BAFTA Awards and three Golden Globes. Connery was the first actor to portray the character James Bond in film, starring in seven Bond films between 1962 and 1983.

name: Peter Sellers
quote: The master of playing men who have no idea how ridiculous they are.
description: an English film actor, comedian and singer. He performed in the BBC Radio comedy series The Goon Show, and became known to a worldwide audience through his film characterizations, among them Chief Inspector Clouseau in The Pink Panther series of films.

name: Michael Caine
quote: Michael Caine has been personifying British cool since the swinging sixties. He has brought some of British cinema's most iconic characters to life and introduced his very own laid-back cockney gangster into pop culture.
description: an English actor, producer, and author. Renowned for his distinctive working class cockney accent, he is regarded as a British film icon. He has brought some of British cinema's most iconic characters to life and introduced his very own laid-back cockney gangster into pop culture.

name: Paul Mccartney
quote: I'm in awe of McCartney. He's about the only one that I am in awe of. He can do it all. And he's never let up ... He's just so damn effortless!
description: an English singer-songwriter, multi-instrumentalist, and composer. He gained worldwide fame as the bass guitarist and singer for the rock band the Beatles. His songwriting partnership with John Lennon was the most successful of the post-war era.

name: John Lennon
quote: The work of John Lennon was marked by its exquisite beauty and by its brutal honesty.
description: an English singer, songwriter, musician, and peace activist who co-founded the Beatles, one of the most influential band in the history of popular music. He and Paul McCartney formed a much-celebrated songwriting partnership.

name: Bob Dylan
quote: Dylan was a revolutionary. Bob freed your mind the way Elvis freed your body. ... To this day, wherever great rock music is being made, there is the shadow of Bob Dylan.
description: an American singer-songwriter, musician, author and painter, who has been an influential figure in popular music and culture for more than 5 decades. In 1960s, he became a ‘voice of a generation’ with songs such as ‘Blowin' in the Wind’ and ‘The Times They Are a-Changin’‘.

name: Jimi Hendrix
quote: Hendrix had conjured with his vision and sense of sound, his personality and genius the most extraordinary guitar music ever played, the most remarkable sound-scape ever created. Of that there is little argument.
description: an American rock guitarist, singer, and songwriter. Although his mainstream career spanned only four years, he is widely regarded as one of the most influential electric guitarists in the history of popular music, and one of the most celebrated musicians of the 20th century.

name: Mick Jagger
quote: Jagger's performance style opened up definitions of gendered masculinity and so laid the foundations for self-invention and sexual plasticity which are now an integral part of contemporary youth culture.
description: an English singer-songwriter, multi-instrumentalist, composer and actor who gained fame as the lead singer and one of the founder members of the Rolling Stones. Jagger has been described as ‘one of the most popular and influential frontmen in the history of rock & roll’.

name: George Harrison
quote: He was a giant, a great, great soul, with all of the humanity, all of the wit and humor, all the wisdom, the spirituality, the common sense of a man and compassion for people.
description: an English guitarist, singer-songwriter, and producer who achieved international fame as the lead guitarist of the Beatles. Harrison embraced Indian culture and helped broaden the scope of popular music through incorporation of its instrumentation and Hindu spirituality.

name: Ringo Starr
quote: Whatever that spark is in Ringo, we all know it but can't put our finger on it. There's something in him that is projectable and he would have surfaced as an individual ... Ringo is a damn good drummer.
description: an English drummer, singer, songwriter and actor who gained worldwide fame as the drummer for the Beatles. Starr's creative contribution to music has received praise from other drummers such as Phil Collins, who described him as ‘a great musician’.

name: Neil Armstrong
quote: As long as there are history books, Neil Armstrong will be included in them, remembered for taking humankind's first small step on a world beyond our own.
description: an American astronaut, engineer, and the first person to walk on the Moon. He was also an aerospace engineer, naval aviator, test pilot, and university professor. Armstrong's second and last spaceflight was as commander of Apollo 11, the first manned Moon landing mission.

name: Kirk Douglas
quote: Cleft-chinned, steely-eyed and virile star of international cinema who rose from being 'the ragman's son' to become a bona fide superstar.
description: an American actor, producer, director, and author. Douglas developed into a leading box-office star throughout the 1950s and 1960s, known for serious dramas, including westerns and war movies. Douglas is well known for his explosive acting style.

name: Burt Reynolds
quote: Enduring, strong-featured, and genial star of US cinema, Burt Reynolds carved his name into 1970s/1980s popular culture as a sex symbol and on-screen as both a rugged action figure and then as a wisecracking, Southern-type 'good ol' boy.'
description: an American actor, director, producer and former college football player. Reynolds went on to star in a number of films, including The Longest Yard (1974), Smokey and the Bandit (1977), Without A Paddle and Boogie Nights.

name: John Travolta
quote: Saturday Night Fever' and 'Grease' made him a '70s icon, but suddenly his career stopped dead - until a decade later when Tarantino cast him in 'Pulp Fiction'.
description: an American actor, film producer, dancer, and singer. Travolta first became known in the 1970s, starring in the box office successes Saturday Night Fever and Grease. His acting career declined through the 1980s, but enjoyed a resurgence in the 1990s with his role in Pulp Fiction.

name: Jack Nicholson
quote: One of Hollywood's still-standing greats from the bygone Hollywood era of machismo leading men who bolstered their silver screen personas with raucous off-screen antics. He's a one of the greatest actors of his generation.
description: an American actor and filmmaker, who has performed for over 60 years. Nicholson is known for playing a wide range of starring or supporting roles, including satirical comedy, romance and dark portrayals of antiheroes and psychopathic characters.

name: Al Pacino
quote: One of the greatest actors in all of film history, Al Pacino established himself during one of film's greatest decades, the 1970s, and has become an enduring and iconic figure in the world of American movies.
description: an American actor of stage and screen, filmmaker, and screenwriter. Pacino has had a career spanning over 5 decades. His performance as Michael Corleone is now regarded as one of the greatest screen performances in film history.

name: Robert De Niro
quote: Considered one of the best actors of his generation, Robert De Niro built a durable star career out of his formidable ability to disappear into a character.
description: an American actor, producer, and director who holds both American and Italian citizenship mostly known for portraying gangster characters. De Niro is also known for his longtime collaboration with director Martin Scorsese.

name: Robert Redford
quote: The rugged, dashingly handsome Robert Redford was among the biggest movie stars of the 1970s.
description: an American actor, director, producer, businessman, environmentalist, and philanthropist. He is the founder of the Sundance Film Festival. In 1973 he had the greatest hit of his career, the blockbuster crime caper The Sting, for which he was nominated for an Academy Award.

name: Dustin Hoffman
quote: You can't define Dustin Hoffman, because he's unique. He's one of a kind and he's not one character. There is no Dustin Hoffman. He is many, many people. . . . He has an enormous range, and yet he's still Dustin somewhere in there.
description: an American actor and a director, with a career in film, television, and theater. Hoffman has been known for his versatile portrayals of antiheroes and vulnerable characters. He won the Academy Award for Best Actor in 1980 for Kramer vs. Kramer, and in 1989 for Rain Man.

name: Gene Hackman
quote: The brilliance of Gene Hackman is that he can look at a scene and he can cut through to what is necessary, and he does it with extraordinary economy, he's the quintessential movie actor.
description: an American actor and novelist. In a career that spanned nearly five decades, Hackman was nominated for five Academy Awards, winning Best Actor in The French Connection and Best Supporting Actor in Unforgiven. He won three Golden Globes and two BAFTAs.

name: Richard Dreyfuss
quote: Richard Dreyfuss is an American leading man, who has played his fair share of irritating pests and brash, ambitious hustlers.
description: an American actor best known for starring in popular films during the 1970s through 1990s, including American Graffiti, Jaws, Stand By Me, Close Encounters of the Third Kind, Down and Out in Beverly Hills, The Goodbye Girl, Always, and Mr. Holland's Opus.

name: Robert Duvall
quote: Duvall has the ability to completely inhabit the person he's acting. He totally and utterly becomes that person to a degree which is uncanny.
description: an American actor and filmmaker. Robert Duvall will long be remembered as one of the great naturalistic American screen actors. His performances in To Kill a Mockingbird, Tomorrow, Godfather, Network, Apocalypse Now rank as some of the finest acting ever put on film.

name: Gene Wilder
quote: Gene Wilder, who established himself as one of America's foremost comic actors with his delightfully neurotic performances.
description: an American actor, screenwriter, director, producer, singer-songwriter and author. Wilder is known for his portrayal of Willy Wonka in Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory (1971) and for his four films with Richard Pryor.

name: Woody Allen
quote: He just has a mind like nobody else. He's bold. He's got a lot of strength, a lot of courage in terms of his work. And that is what it takes to do something really unique. Along with a genius imagination.
description: an American filmmaker, writer, actor, comedian, and musician whose career spans more than six decades.  As a comedian, he developed the persona of an insecure, intellectual, fretful nebbish, which he maintains is quite different from his real-life personality.

name: Donald Sutherland
quote: Funny, intelligent and shrewd in his choices, Donald Sutherland is an actor who can steal a scene without seeming to do anything at all.
description: a Canadian actor whose film career spans more than five decades. He subsequently established himself as one of the most respected, prolific and versatile character actors of Canada. His films include The Dirty Dozen (1967), M*A*S*H (1970), Kelly's Heroes (1970), Klute (1971).

name: Harvey Keitel
quote: With his trademark Brooklyn accent and his portrayals of no-nonsense tough guys, this Oscar-nominated actor has turned in his fair share of acting gold.
description: an American actor and producer. An Oscar and Golden Globe Award nominee, he has appeared in films such as Mean Streets, Taxi Driver and The Last Temptation of Christ, The Duellists and Thelma & Louise, Reservoir Dogs and Pulp Fiction, Moonrise Kingdom and Youth.

name: John Cleese
quote: He's a brilliant actor and writer, and the tallest member of Monty Python. He's also a founding father of modern comedy, whose multitude of fans will be hanging on his every word!
description: an English actor, voice actor, comedian, screenwriter, and producer. In the late 1960s, he co-founded Monty Python, the comedy troupe responsible for the sketch show Monty Python's Flying Circus and the four Monty Python films.

name: Laurence Olivier
quote: His performances were electrifying...I admired their originality and courage...and their terror. There is no acting like it today. He made me want to become part of the theater.
description: an English actor and director who, along with his contemporaries Ralph Richardson and John Gielgud, dominated the British stage of the mid-20th century. He also worked in films throughout his career, playing more than fifty cinema roles.

name: Martin Sheen
quote: Martin Sheen is one of America's most celebrated, colorful, and accomplished actors. Moving flawlessly between artistic mediums, Sheen's acting range is striking.
description: an American actor who first became known for his roles in the films The Subject Was Roses and Badlands, and later achieved wide recognition for his leading role in Apocalypse Now. Sheen's other films include Gandhi, Gettysburg, The Departed, and The Amazing Spider-Man.

name: Malcolm McDowell
quote: Blue-eyed British actor Malcolm McDowell has a history of playing angry, cruel characters that still managed to be charming.
description: an English actor, known for his boisterous and sometimes villainous roles. His most known role is as Alex DeLarge in A Clockwork Orange. Throughout a career spanning over fifty years, McDowell has played varied film roles across different genres as a character actor.

name: Maximilian Schell
quote: Despite his rugged good looks, Schell eschewed leading-man roles in favour of more-complex individuals, many of whom were drawn from the Nazi era.
description: an Austrian-born Swiss film and stage actor, who also wrote, directed and produced some of his own films. He won the Academy Award for Best Actor for the 1961 American film Judgment at Nuremberg, his second acting role in Hollywood.

name: Richard Roundtree
quote: The First Black Action Hero.
description: an American actor. He has been called "the first black action hero" for his portrayal of private detective John Shaft in the 1971 film Shaft, and its sequels, Shaft's Big Score (1972) and Shaft in Africa (1973).

name: Christopher Walken
quote: Walken is fascinating because he has a complex and fearless process -- each take is wildly different and he does that until he finds the one that is true perfection.
description: an American stage and film lead and character actor. Nervous-looking lead and supporting actor of the American stage and films, with sandy colored hair, pale complexion and a nervous disposition. He won an Oscar as Best Supporting Actor for his performance in The Deer Hunter.

name: Mickey Rourke
quote: Mickey Rourke straddled the line between athlete and actor as a retired boxer who went on to revitalize his career as an actor in action films.
description: an American actor, screenwriter, and retired boxer. In 1991 Rourke left acting and became a professional boxer for a time. In 2005 Rourke made his comeback in mainstream Hollywood circles with a lead role in the neo-noir action thriller Sin City.

name: Harrison Ford
quote: It’s just really incredible to work with. Normally I’d say there are hundreds of ways to play any scene. Unless you work with Harrison and you realize there’s only one great way and he’s figured it out.
description: an American actor and film producer. He gained worldwide fame for his starring roles as Han Solo in the Star Wars film series and as the title character of the Indiana Jones film series. Ford is also known for his role as Rick Deckard in the Blade Runner.

name: Kevin Costner
quote: One of Hollywood's most prominent strong, silent types, who is best known for his outstanding portrayal of rugged individuals with complex emotions.
description: an American actor, director, producer, and musician. Costner has played in The Untouchables, Bull Durham, Field of Dreams, Dances with Wolves, for which he won Academy Awards for Best Director and Best Picture, JFK, Robin Hood: Prince of Thieves, The Bodyguard.

name: Mel Gibson
quote: Mel Gibson was the definition of a movie star in the '80s and '90s. He was an action hero, he was an Academy Award-winning director, and he was on top of the world.
description: an American actor and filmmaker. Gibson is best known as an action hero, for roles such as Martin Riggs in the Lethal Weapon buddy cop film series, and Max Rockatansky in the first three films in the Mad Max post-apocalyptic action series.

name: Gerard Depardieu
quote: The element of physical menace and self-regarding sensitivity - his feral power, combined with a wounded sensibility and flayed vulnerability - is the essence of his dramatic persona.
description: a French actor, filmmaker, businessman and vineyard owner. He is one of the most prolific character actors in film history. He received critical acclaim for his performances in The Last Metro, Police, Jean de Florette, and Cyrano de Bergerac.

name: Bill Murray
quote: Murray is a master of subtlety. Coupled with his trademark dry delivery, his blank expressions are priceless. No actor can fill a seemingly vacant stare with more twinkle and mirth.
description: an American actor, comedian, and writer. He first gained exposure on Saturday Night Live and later starred in comedy films, including Tootsie, Ghostbusters, and Groundhog Day. Murray garnered additional critical acclaim later in his career, starring in Lost in Translation.

name: Danny Glover
quote: Towering and quietly forceful, Glover lends gravity and complexity to the diverse characters he has portrayed throughout his lengthy career.
description: an American actor, film director, and political activist. He is well known for his leading role as Roger Murtaugh in the Lethal Weapon film series, The Color Purple, To Sleep with Anger, Predator 2, and Angels in the Outfield.

name: Michael J. Fox
quote: He is best known for his boyish good looks, frenetic charm, and remarkable comic timing.
description: a Canadian-American actor, author, producer, and activist. With a film and television career spanning from the 1970s, Fox starred in the Back to the Future trilogy, where he portrayed Marty McFly. Fox was diagnosed with Parkinson's disease in 1991, at age 29.

name: Rutger Hauer
quote: Blonde, blue-eyed, tall and handsome Dutch actor Rutger Hauer has an international reputation for playing everything from romantic leads to action heroes to sinister villains.
description: a Dutch actor, writer, and environmentalist. He has acted in both Dutch and English-language TV series and films. His film credits include Flesh+Blood, Blind Fury, Blade Runner, The Hitcher, Escape from Sobibor, Nighthawks, Wedlock, Sin City.

name: Chevy Chase
quote: The prematurely balding, intelligent, fast-talking Chase created a couple classic characters, but his career is often thought of as plagued by misfires and missed opportunities, rather than touched by comic brilliance.
description: an American actor and comedian. He became a key cast member in the Saturday Night Live. Chase had his first leading film role in the comedy Foul Play. He is further known for his portrayals of Clark Griswold in 5 National Lampoon's Vacation films and Irwin ‘Fletch’ Fletcher.

name: Danny DeVito
quote: Singlehandedly portraying characters with mile-long, obnoxious jerk streaks that are nonetheless somehow loveable, DeVito - with his diminutive stature, balding head, and broad Jersey accent - made an art form out of playing endearingly loathsome little men.
description: an American actor, producer and director. A major film star, he is known for his roles in series Taxi, Tin Men, Throw Momma from the Train, One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest, Ruthless People, Man on the Moon, Terms of Endearment, Twins, Batman Returns, Big Fish.

name: Steve Martin
quote: He was at once a hammy populist with an uncanny, unprecedented feel for the tastes of a mass audience and a sly intellectual whose goofy shtick cunningly deconstructed stand-up comedy.
description: an American actor, comedian, writer, producer and musician. In the 1970s, Martin performed his absurdist comedy routines before packed houses on national tours. Since the 1980s Martin has become a successful actor, as well as an author, playwright, pianist, and banjo player.

name: Jim Belushi
quote: The easy-going actor with the crooked smile managed to forge a respectable career playing co-leads in a variety of film genres, including comedy, action, and drama in roles ranging from a sleazeball thief to a cop to a party animal in a gorilla suit.
description: an American comic actor, voice actor, comedian, singer and musician. He played the role of Jim Orenthal on the sitcom According to Jim. Belushi has appeared in films such as Thief, Trading Places, About Last Night, Salvador, Red Heat, K-9, Mr. Destiny, and Curly Sue.

name: Willem Dafoe
quote: Known for the darkly eccentric characters he often plays, Willem Dafoe is one of the screen's more provocative and engaging actors. Strong-jawed and wiry, his looks make him ideal for playing the boy next door -- if you happen to live next door to a mausoleum.
description: an American actor. One of the most prolific character actors of American cinema, Dafoe has appeared in films including The Last Temptation of Christ, Mississippi Burning, Born on the Fourth of July, The English Patient, the Spider-Man trilogy, John Wick, The Grand Budapest Hotel.

name: Arnold Schwarzenegger
quote: What Arnold really needed was a super hero / warrior style role in a lavish production that utilized his chiseled physique, and gave him room to show off his growing acting talents and quirky humor.
description: an Austrian-American actor, producer, businessman, investor, author, philanthropist, activist, politician, and former professional bodybuilder. He has appeared in a number of films, such as Terminator, Commando, The Running Man, Predator, Total Recall, and True Lies.

name: Sylvester Stallone
quote: This athletically built, dark-haired icon of machismo and Hollywood action heroism, Sylvester Stallone is responsible for creating two characters who have become a part of the American cultural lexicon: Rocky Balboa and John Rambo.
description: an American actor and filmmaker. He is well known for his Hollywood action roles, including boxer Rocky Balboa, the title character of the Rocky series' seven films, soldier John Rambo from the four Rambo films, and Barney Ross in the three The Expendables films.

name: John Hurt
quote: A small man with a slightly sinister countenance and a tenor voice that never completed the transition between early adolescence and manhood, John Hurt is considered one of Great Britain's most consistently brilliant players.
description: an English actor whose screen and stage career spanned more than 50 years. Hurt was regarded as one of Britain's finest actors. David Lynch described him as ‘simply the greatest actor in the world’. He played in A Man for All Seasons, Midnight Express, Alien.

name: Eddie Murphy
quote: Like Bill Cosby and Richard Pryor before him, Eddie Murphy was the preeminent African-American comic of his era. In fact, Murphy was arguably the preeminent comic of the 1980s, period - at his peak, no other performer was a bigger star or a more audacious talent.
description: an American comedian, actor, writer, singer, and producer. Murphy was a regular cast member on Saturday Night Live. In films, Murphy has received critical acclaim for his performances in 48 Hrs., the Beverly Hills Cop series, Trading Places, The Nutty Professor, and Dreamgirls.

name: Val Kilmer
quote: Actor Val Kilmer's chameleon-like ability to plunge fully and breathlessly into his characters represents both the gift that catapulted him to fame in the mid eighties, and that which - by its very nature of anonymity - held him back from megastardom for some time.
description: an American actor. Originally a stage actor, Kilmer became popular in the mid-1980s after a string of appearances in comedy films, starting with Top Secret!, then the cult classic Real Genius, as well as the military action film Top Gun and the fantasy film Willow.

name: Tom Cruise
quote: If there’s one thing you can count on when you see a Tom Cruise franchise action movie, it’s the look on his face. It is cool and poised, sleek and alert, it’s all dashing resolve.
description: an American actor and producer. Since 1996, Cruise has been well known for his role as IMF agent Ethan Hunt in the Mission: Impossible film series. His filmography includes Born on the Fourth of July, Jerry Maguire, Magnolia, Vanilla Sky, The Last Samurai, and Minority Report.

name: Tom Hanks
quote: He portrays innocence perfectly. He's always the underdog, somebody with a lot to lose, and that's how he makes you care: he makes you understand the pain of loss, and the virtue of love. The fundamentally decent, good-hearted, noble but humble all-American everyman.
description: an American actor and filmmaker. Hanks is known for his comedic and dramatic roles in such films as Splash, Big, Turner & Hooch, Apollo 13, The Green Mile, Cast Away, Philadelphia and Forrest Gump. He is also known for his collaborations with film director Steven Spielberg.

name: George Clooney
quote: Handsome man, fine actor and a major Holywood player, Clooney has comedic timing and a gracious ability to share the screen while maintaining magnetism.
description: an American actor, director, producer, screenwriter, activist, businessman, and philanthropist. He has received two Academy Awards, one for acting in Syriana and the other for co-producing Argo. Clooney gained wide recognition in the long-running medical drama ER (1994-1999).

name: Leonardo DiCaprio
quote: He's a fluid and instinctive actor, with the face of a mischievous angel.
description: an American actor, film producer, and environmental activist. He gained public recognition with leading roles in The Basketball Diaries (1995) and the romantic drama Romeo + Juliet (1996), before achieving international fame with James Cameron's epic romance Titanic (1997).

name: Johnny Depp
quote: Johnny Depp survived the perils of adolescent heartthrob status to earn a reputation as a serious, if idiosyncratic performer, a real-life role that has continuously surprised critics intent on writing him off as just another photogenic Tiger Beat casualty.
description: an American actor, producer, and musician. He rose to prominence on the 1980s television series 21 Jump Street, becoming a teen idol. He is most famous for his role in Pirates of the Caribbean and has collaborated on 9 films with director and friend Tim Burton.

name: Brad Pitt
quote: Someone once said that Pitt is essentially a character actor trapped in a leading man's body, and I could not agree more with that, he was "too damn affable" to reach the depths that he wanted to in his acting.
description: an American actor and producer. His first roles came with the A River Runs Through It and Interview with the Vampire. He gave critically acclaimed performances in the Seven and 12 Monkeys. Pitt starred in the Fight Club, Troy, The Curious Case of Benjamin Button and Moneyball.

name: Keanu Reeves
quote: From lamebrained teenage time traveler to metaphysical sci-fi Superman, Keanu Reeves has portrayed just about every character type imaginable in his sometimes wildly fluctuating career.
description: a Canadian actor, director, producer, and musician. Reeves is best known for his acting career, beginning in 1985. He gained fame for his starring role performances in the Bill and Ted franchise, Speed, the John Wick franchise, The Devil's Advocate, Constantine and The Matrix.

name: Matt Damon
quote: The star who has quietly and steadily turned into a great Everyman actor is in nimble control as he reveals his character's deep crazies.
description: an American actor, film producer, philanthropist and screenwriter. He came to prominence when he wrote and starred in Good Will Hunting with Ben Affleck. His other roles include as Saving Private Ryan, The Talented Mr. Ripley, The Departed, Bourne franchise, The Martian.

name: Jim Carrey
quote: When one thinks of actor Jim Carrey, what comes to mind is that expressive face and impeccable comic timing. Carrey has been one of the most sought after actors in Hollywood.
description: a Canadian-American actor, comedian, impressionist, screenwriter, and producer. He is known for his highly energetic slapstick performances. His roles include Ace Ventura, Dumb and Dumber, The Mask, The Truman Show, Man on the Moon, How the Grinch Stole Christmas.

name: Bruce Willis
quote: It's not just that he's so incredibly cool, it's that he makes you feel like you're cool too. He is the bouncer who listens to you and smiles as he's tossing you from the bar.
description: an American actor, producer, and singer. He is known for Moonlighting series, Die Hard and its 4 sequels, Pulp Fiction, Nobody's Fool, 12 Monkeys, The Fifth Element, Armageddon, The Sixth Sense, Unbreakable, Sin City, Red, Moonrise Kingdom and Looper.

name: Kevin Spacey
quote: Not since Laurence Olivier has a man been so singularly emblematic to the profession of acting as Kevin Spacey.  A Julliard graduate who cut his teeth performing Shakespeare and Chekov, he is equally equipped with unflappable cool, Carsonesque wit, and abundant charm.
description: an American actor, director, producer, screenwriter, and singer. He gained critical acclaim in the 1990s with The Usual Suspects, and American Beauty. His other roles have included Seven, L.A. Confidential, K-PAX, Beyond the Sea. Spacey played main role in the House of Cards.

name: Edward Norton
quote: Edward Norton is one of the tougher actors to categorize: while he certainly has a casting ‘type’,  he is also dynamic.  Norton fits in both a character and personality actor. He is known for playing roles in which he is intelligent, yet mentally troubled.
description: an American actor and filmmaker. He has been nominated for three Academy Awards for his work in the films Primal Fear, American History X and Birdman. He also starred Fight Club, Red Dragon, 25th Hour, Kingdom of Heaven, The Illusionist, Moonrise Kingdom.

name: Brendan Fraser
quote: A muscular, darkly handsome actor who defies easy categorization, Brendan Fraser has an enviable versatility that has allowed him to be equally convincing in comedies, dramas, and adventure films alike.
description: a Canadian-American actor. He is best known for playing Rick O'Connell in The Mummy trilogy and for his comedy and fantasy films, such as Encino Man, George of the Jungle, Bedazzled, Looney Tunes: Back in Action and Journey to the Center of the Earth.

name: Robin Williams
quote: An improvisational master, his words rush forth in a gush of manic energy. 'One moment acting as a bright, mischievous child, then as a wise philosopher or alien from outer space'.
description: an American stand-up comedian and actor. He is credited with leading San Francisco's comedy renaissance. He was known for his improvisational skills and roles in Good Morning, Vietnam, Dead Poets Society, Aladdin, Good Will Hunting, Hook, Mrs. Doubtfire, Jumanji.

name: Richard Gere
quote: More coolly charismatic than drop-dead handsome, Richard Gere was one of the most successful sex symbols of the '80s and early '90s. Possessing something of an actual talent in addition to his good looks, Gere has proven himself to be a versatile actor.
description: an American actor and humanitarian activist. He came to prominence with his role in the film American Gigolo. He went on to star in many well-received films, including An Officer and a Gentleman, The Cotton Club, Pretty Woman, Primal Fear, Runaway Bride, Chicago.

name: David Duchovny
quote: Rocketing from obscure bit player to TV's resident ?ber-sex god thanks to his role as FBI agent Fox Mulder on The X-Files, David Duchovny can claim to have had one of the 1990s' more remarkable career metamorphoses.
description: an American actor, writer, producer, director, novelist, and singer-songwriter. He is known for playing FBI Agent Fox Mulder on the television series The X-Files and writer Hank Moody on the television series Californication.

name: Will Smith
