quote: That Philadelphia’s favorite rapper-turned-actor has unquestionable sincerity of intent in every role he takes on. Sometimes it’s to connect on big issues, and sometimes it’s merely for epic, popcorn entertainment.
description: an American actor, producer, rapper, comedian, and songwriter. In the late 1980s, Smith achieved modest fame as a rapper under the name The Fresh Prince. His famous roles include series The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air, Ali, The Pursuit of Happyness, I Am Legend and Hancock.

name: Anthony Hopkins
quote: He is often seen at his best when playing pathetic misfits or characters on the fringes of insanity. There's such an organic relationship between his words and his thoughts. He doesn't need to say it, because he's feeling it. It screams through the screen.
description: a Welsh film, stage, and television actor. Hopkins is well known for his portrayal of Hannibal Lecter in The Silence of the Lambs. Other notable films include The Mask of Zorro, The Bounty, Meet Joe Black, The Elephant Man, Magic, 84 Charing Cross Road, Bram Stoker's Dracula.

name: Ben Affleck
quote: Tall and handsome in a meat-eating sort of way, Ben Affleck has the looks of a matinee idol and the r?sum? of an actor who honed his craft as an indie film slacker before flexing his muscles as a Hollywood star.
description: an American actor, director, screenwriter and producer. Affleck gained wider recognition when he wrote and starred in Good Will Hunting with Matt Damon. His roles include Armageddon, Pearl Harbor, Daredevil, Gone Girl. He is also directed Gone Baby Gone, The Town and Argo.

name: Denzel Washington
quote: One of Hollywood's sexiest and most magnetic leading men, Denzel Washington's poise and radiantly sane intelligence permeate whatever film he is in, be it a socially conscious drama, biopic, or suspense thriller.
description: an American actor, director, and producer. His famous roles include Glory, Training Day, Cry Freedom, Malcolm X, The Hurricane, Remember the Titans, The Great Debaters, and American Gangster.

name: Russell Crowe
quote: No matter what kind of characters he plays, Crowe's weather-beaten handsomeness and gruff charisma combine to make him constantly watchable: his one-time Hollywood mentor Sharon Stone has called him 'the sexiest guy working in movies today'.
description: an actor, film producer and musician. He came to international attention for his role in the Gladiator. Crowe also appeared in The Insider, A Beautiful Mind, Romper Stomper, L.A. Confidential, Cinderella Man, American Gangster Robin Hood, Les Misérables, Man of Steel and Noah.

name: Heath Ledger
quote: For his age, Heath has an incredible manliness about him. I think he has a strong sense of himself, but it's especially amazing in someone so young, because usually male stars don't develop that kind of thing until their thirties.
description: an Australian actor and director. His work comprised nineteen films, including 10 Things I Hate About You, The Patriot, A Knight's Tale, Monster's Ball, Lords of Dogtown, Brokeback Mountain, The Dark Knight, and The Imaginarium of Doctor Parnassus.

name: Ryan Gosling
quote: Like Steve McQueen, he embodies presence and sincerity ... he has shown a gift for finding arresting, powerful characters and can achieve just about anything.
description: a Canadian actor and musician. He came to the attention of a wider audience in 2004 with a leading role in the The Notebook. His other performances include Half Nelson, Real Girl, Blue Valentine, Crazy, Stupid, Love, The Ides of March, Drive, The Big Short and the La La Land.

name: Ryan Reynolds
quote: Cool, but accessible Reynolds has a softer, mellower, even weaker voice, which betrays his good looks and helps to reveal the vulnerability. Even in the superhero movies, Reynolds' true style comes about in showing his vulnerable, and therefore funny and romantic sides.
description: a Canadian actor. Some of his most prominent roles include Hillside, Two Guys and a Girl, and various comic book characters: Hannibal King in Blade: Trinity, and Deadpool in X-Men Origins: Wolverine  and Deadpool. He also portrayed a DC Comics superhero Green Lantern.

name: Hugh Jackman
quote: Jackman is perfect at playing refined gentlemen, and famous for his moody, archetypal Marvel hero, Wolverine. Even though he's right for any romantic comedy, it's in the more satisfying, deeper, and "dual" characters that he excels.
description: an Australian actor, singer, and producer. Jackman is known for his long-running role as Wolverine in the X-Men film series, as well as for his lead roles in films such as Kate & Leopold, Van Helsing, The Prestige, The Fountain, Australia, Les Misérables and Prisoners.

name: Christian Bale
quote: With a wistful handsomeness to complement his impressive, sometimes underrated talent, Bale has become something of a quiet sensation, netting choice roles in a number of unconventional, critically acclaimed films.
description: an English actor. He has starred both in blockbuster films and smaller projects from independent producers and art houses. Bale’s most famous roles include Empire of the Sun, Psycho, The Machinist, Batman in Nolan's trilogy, The Fighter, American Hustle and The Big Short.

name: Matthew McConaughey
quote: Few actors have ever transformed themselves quite like Matthew McConaughey. Beginning his career as a lovable stoner, the artist defined himself by a string of romantic comedies throughout the 2000s before completely reinventing himself in recent years.
description: an American actor, director, producer, and writer. In the 2000s, he became best known for starring in romantic comedies, including The Wedding Planner, Fool's Gold. Later, he has preferred dramatic roles, in such films as The Lincoln Lawyer, Dallas Buyers Club, True Detective.

name: Elijah Wood
quote: Wood was an outstanding child actor, and seems to have made a successful transition to adult actor by keeping a lot of that childhood innocence. At times transitioning the innocence into cluelessness, loner, nerd or hobbit, he makes his quiet confusion work.
description: an American actor, voice actor, DJ, and producer. He is best known for his role as Frodo Baggins in epic film trilogy The Lord of the Rings. He is also knows for, Sin City, Green Street, Everything Is Illuminated, and Bobby, Wilfred, Dirk Gently's Holistic Detective Agency.

name: Daniel Radcliffe
quote: While there may be a number of people in the world who do not recognize the name of Daniel Radcliffe, many millions do know the name of the character he plays: Harry Potter, boy wizard and hero of the best-selling books and blockbuster films.
description: an English actor best known for his role as Harry Potter in the film series of the same name. His recent films include the horror film The Woman in Black, playing beat poet Allen Ginsberg in the independent film Kill Your Darlings, Victor Frankenstein, Swiss Army Man, Imperium.

name: Ewan McGregor
quote: He started out as the ‘90s version of Malcolm McDowell - smart, cool, British extreme bad boy. He changes himself and the type of film he’s in constantly.  In some circles, that’s called acting.
description: a Scottish actor, known internationally for his various film roles, including independent dramas, science-fiction epics, and musicals. Some of his most well-known roles include Trainspotting, Jedi Obi-Wan Kenobi in the Star Wars, Moulin Rouge!,  Big Fish, The Ghost Writer.

name: Orlando Bloom
quote: For a while following two of the most profitable franchises in film history, the British heartthrob was utterly inescapable. From The Lord of the Rings to Pirates of the Caribbean, Bloom’s star shone brighter than arguably any other actor of his age in the early 2000s.
description: an English actor. After having his breakthrough as Legolas in The Lord of the Rings trilogy, he rose to fame by further appearing in epic fantasy, historical epic, and fantasy adventure films. His other roles include Will Turner in the Pirates of the Caribbean, and Paris in Troy.

name: Tobey Maguire
quote: Moon-faced, dreamy eyed, and radiating the kind of lo-fi intensity that made him a natural for the kind of Thoughtful Young Man roles in which he made his name during the early years of his career.
description: an American actor and producer. He is known for playing the title character in Sam Raimi's Spider-Man film trilogy as well as for his roles in Pleasantville, The Cider House Rules, Wonder Boys, Seabiscuit, The Good German, Brothers, and The Great Gatsby.

name: Adam Sandler
quote: One of the most endearing goofballs to ever grace the stages of Saturday Night Live, affectionately offensive funnyman Adam Sandler has often been cited as the writer/performer who almost single-handedly rescued the long-running late-night television staple.
description: an American actor, comedian, screenwriter, film producer, and musician. After becoming a Saturday Night Live cast member, Sandler went on to star in many Hollywood films such as Billy Madison, Happy Gilmore, The Wedding Singer, Big Daddy, Mr. Deeds, Punch-Drunk Love.

name: Ben Stiller
quote: Generation X's answer to Woody Allen. Only Ben is not a quiet neurotic loser, he's often a loud, complaining, obnoxious, angry neurotic loser. Still very, very, funny, though. And his acting is smart and much more precise than his fellow Frat Packers.
description: an American actor, comedian and filmmaker. Throughout his career he has written, starred in, directed, or produced more than 50 films, including The Secret Life of Walter Mitty, Zoolander, The Cable Guy, the Meet the Parents, Tropic Thunder, and the Night at the Museum trilogy.

name: Robert Downey Jr.
quote: Hailed by many critics as one of the most brilliant and versatile actors of his generation, Robert Downey Jr. possesses an ability to pour forth immense feeling into even minor scenes. He wears his soul on his sleeve.
description: an American actor and singer. His career has included critical and popular success in his youth (Chaplin), followed by a period of substance abuse, and a resurgence of commercial success in middle age (Zodiac, Tropic Thunder). In 2008, he began portraying the role of Iron Man.

name: Chris Hemsworth
quote: Aussie macho, Chris has barely had a chance to show anything but muscles and a great rugged voice and accent. As a member of the Avengers, he will be playing Thor for some time.
description: an Australian actor. He is known for playing Kim Hyde in the Australian TV series Home and Away and Thor in the Marvel Universe since 2011. He has also appeared in Star Trek,The Cabin in the Woods, Snow White and the Huntsman, Red Dawn, Rush and Heart of the Sea.

name: Chris Evans
quote: Evans' bravado works because there is just enough humor and a trace of self-effacement, or rather self-reference. The tongue in cheek quality that moves through much of Evans' work has as part of it an acknowledgment that this is acting, and it's fun.
description: an American actor and filmmaker. Evans is known for his superhero roles as the Marvel Comics characters Steve Rogers / Captain America in the Marvel Cinematic Universe and Johnny Storm / Human Torch in Fantastic Four and its 2007 sequel.

name: Joaquin Phoenix
quote: With whispery whine, the intensely feeling yet macho bearing and the pouty look with some effeminate features Joaquin Phoenix has made a career out of making a couple of films, disappearing, and then reappearing from the ashes to rise upward toward greater glory.
description: an American actor, producer, music video director, musician, and activist. He received international attention for his portrayal of Commodus in the Gladiator. His famous roles include Walk the Line, The Master, Buffalo Soldiers, Signs, Two Lovers, The Immigrant, Her, Inherent Vice.

name: Bradley Cooper
quote: With his rugged good looks and perfect comic timing, Cooper has become a film star on the rise. He has boyish charm and regularly opting for the challenging and provocative, risking the laid-back image that propelled him to fame.
description: an American actor. His breakthrough role came in 2009 with The Hangover. He found greater success with the Limitless, The Place Beyond the Pines, Silver Linings Playbook, American Hustle, and American Sniper.

name: Joseph Gordon-Levitt
quote: Surprisingly formidable, and formidably surprising, leading man, who defied the cliched fates that befall most underage actors when they grow up, one of the hottest young stars in the indie firmament.
description: an American actor, filmmaker, singer and entrepreneur. As a child, he appeared in the films such as 10 Things I Hate About You. He has also starred in (500) Days of Summer, Inception, Hesher, 50/50, Premium Rush, The Dark Knight Rises, Brick, Looper, The Walk, Snowden.

name: Theda Bara
quote: I will continue doing vampires as long as people sin.
description: an American silent film and stage actress. Bara was one of the most popular actresses of the silent era, and one of cinema's earliest sex symbols. Bara made more than 40 films between 1914 and 1926, but most were lost in the 1937 Fox vault fire.

name: Anne Caldwell
quote: One of the most prolific librettists known to show business. A quiet, unassuming woman she developed a technique that rarely failed and was both book writer and lyricist.
description: a prolific playwright and lyricist. Variety called her ‘one of the most prolific librettists known to show business. A quiet, unassuming woman she developed a technique that rarely failed and was both book writer and lyricist’.

name: Marie Dressler
quote: The greatest low comedienne of the world.
description: a Canadian-American stage and screen actress, comedian, and early silent film and Depression-era film star. In 1914, she was in the first full-length film comedy and later won the Academy Award for Best Actress in 1931.

name: Lillian Gish
quote: Lillian Gish is considered the movie industry's first true actress. More than any other early star, she fought to earn film recognition as a true art form, and her achievements remain the standard against which those of all other actors are measured.
description: an American actress of the screen and stage, as well as a director and writer. Her film acting career spanned 75 years, from 1912 to 1987. Gish was called the First Lady of American Cinema, and she is credited with pioneering fundamental film performing techniques.

name: Florence Lawrence
quote: She may be remembered by many as a tragic figure, but her available films preserve her talent and vibrant presence-a moving record of the spunky young woman once known across the nation as 'The Biograph Girl.'
description: a Canadian-American stage performer and film actress. She is often referred to as ‘The First Movie Star’, and was the first film actor to be named publicly. At the height of her fame in the 1910s, she was known as ‘The Biograph Girl’.

name: Mae Murray
quote: Mae's bee-stung lips were being compared to Douglas Fairbanks's smile, Ethel Barrymore's poise, and Maude Adams's wistfulness.
description: an American actress, dancer, film producer, and screenwriter. Murray rose to fame during the silent film era and was known as ‘The Girl with the Bee-Stung Lips’ and ‘The Gardenia of the Screen’.

name: Alla Nazimova
quote: Nazimova's legacy in my opinion should recognize her intelligence and her bravery but especially her feminism.
description: a Russian actress who immigrated to the United States in 1905. On Broadway, she was noted for her work in the classic plays of Ibsen, Chekhov and Turgenev. Her efforts at silent film were less successful, but a few sound-film performances survive as a record of her art.

name: Pola Negri
quote: Hollywood's First Femme Fatale.
description: a Polish stage and film actress who achieved worldwide fame during the silent and golden eras of Hollywood and European film for her tragedienne and femme fatale roles. She was the first European film star to be invited to Hollywood.

name: Anna Q. Nilsson
quote: Everyone already has a picture in his or her head of the Nordic goddess - this pretty much characterizes Anna.
description: a Swedish born American actress who achieved success in American silent movies. Films of special note for Anna were Regeneration (1915), Seven Keys to Baldpate (1917), Soldiers of Fortune (1919), The Toll Gate and The Luck of the Irish (1920), and The Lotus Eater (1921).

name: Mary Pickford
quote: No role she can play on the screen is as great as the role she plays in the motion picture industry. Mary Pickford the actress is completely overshadowed by Mary Pickford the individual.
description: a Canadian-born film actress and producer. Known in her prime as ‘America's Sweetheart’ and the ‘girl with the curls’, Pickford was one of the Canadian pioneers in early Hollywood and a significant figure in the development of film acting.

name: Gloria Swanson
quote: I am big. It's the movies that got small.
description: an American actress and producer best known for her role as Norma Desmond, a reclusive silent film star, in the critically acclaimed 1950 film Sunset Boulevard. Swanson was also a star in the silent film era as both an actress and a fashion icon.

name: Blanche Sweet
quote: She was never interested in being -quote - 'a star', she was interested in being an actress.
description: an American silent film actress who began her career in the earliest days of the Hollywood motion picture film industry. Sweet was known for her energetic, independent roles, at variance with the 'ideal' Griffith type of vulnerable, often fragile, femininity.

name: Sophie Tucker
quote: She just was this kind of larger-than-life character who just didn't give a damn about traditional ideals of being beautiful, or being thin or any of that.
description: a Ukrainian-born American singer, comedian, actress, and radio personality, ’The Last of the Red Hot Mamas’.  Known for her stentorian delivery of comical and risqué songs, she was one of the most popular entertainers in America during the first half of the 20th century.

name: Pearl White
quote: Queen of the Serials.
description: an American stage and film actress. Dubbed the ‘Queen of the Serials’, White was noted for doing the majority of her own stunts in several film serials, most notably in The Perils of Pauline. White's place in film history is important in the evolution of cinema genres and the role of women.

name: Mabel Normand
quote: Watching her was a slap in the face with a perfumed glove.
description: an American silent film actress, screenwriter, director, and producer. Onscreen, she appeared in 12 successful films with Charlie Chaplin and 17 with Roscoe Arbuckle, sometimes writing and directing movies featuring Chaplin as her leading man.

name: Dorothy Gish
quote: Dorothy was much more talented than I am because she had wit. I couldn't make people laugh, but Dorothy could make them cry and laugh, so therefore she was the better actress than I was.
description: an American actress of the screen and stage, as well as a director and writer. Dorothy and her older sister Lillian Gish were major movie stars of the silent era. Gish was noted as a fine comedian, and many of her films were comedies.

name: Vera Kholodnaya
quote: By the mid 1918 Vera Kholodnaya turned from just a popular and admired actress into a true phenomenon of the Russian cinema.
description: the first star of Russian silent cinema. Though Vera Kholodnaya was into filming for only 3 years, it was enough for her to become the Queen of Screen, as she was titled. Unluckily, only 5 films starring her are extant nowadays out of the 50 to 80 films she played in.

name: Mata Hari
quote: The qualities that made her embody sex, glamour, intrigue and danger got her executed.
description: a Dutch exotic dancer and courtesan who was convicted of being a spy for Germany during World War I and executed by firing squad in France.

name: Mary Anderson
quote: Star of the False Faces and Bubbles, with golden hair and blue eyes, she was an expert swimmer.
description: an American actress, who appeared in 77 silent films between 1914 and 1923. A popular player, she probably did her best work in Irvin Willat's feature production, The False Faces. Anderson produced her own film, Bubbles, which had a splendid reception by the public.

name: Florence Roberts
quote: Florence Roberts was able to convey extreme youth on-stage even in her forties and fifties.
description: an early-twentieth-century American stage actress. In 1912 she was one of the first famous stage stars to appear in a film version of a famous play ‘Sapho’. Roberts appeared in four more silent pictures up to 1925.

name: Josephine Baker
quote: The magnetic Josephine Baker never ceased to rally against racial discrimination and gender inequality - albeit in her own, fabulous way.
description: an entertainer, activist, and French Resistance agent. Her performance in the revue Un Vent de Folie in 1927 caused a sensation in Paris. Her costume, consisting of only a girdle of bananas, became her most iconic image and a symbol of the Jazz Age and the 1920s.

name: Clara Bow
quote: Her emotions were close to the surface. She could cry on demand, opening the floodgate of tears almost as soon as I asked her to weep. She was dynamite, full of nervous energy and vitality and pitifully eager to please everyone.
description: an American actress who rose to stardom in silent film during the 1920s and successfully made the transition to ‘talkies’ after 1927. Bow came to personify the Roaring Twenties and is described as its leading sex symbol.

name: Louise Brooks
quote: There is no Garbo! There is no Dietrich! There is only Louise Brooks!
description: an American film actress and dancer noted as an iconic symbol of the flapper, and for popularizing the bobbed haircut. Brooks is best known as the lead in three feature films made in Europe: Pandora's Box (1929), Diary of a Lost Girl (1929), and Miss Europe (1930).

name: Anna May Wong
quote: Wong's acting was subtle and unmannered, her eyebrow game was on point. Her tone was refined, cool, cultured, like a slap in the face to anyone who'd assumed otherwise.
description: an American actress. She is considered to be the first Chinese American movie star, and also the first Asian American actress to gain international recognition. Her long and varied career spanned silent film, sound film, television, stage, and radio.

name: Betty Bronson
quote: Yours is the only Peter Pan I've ever cared for.
description: an American television and film actress who began her career during the silent film era. Bronson had a major role in the 1925 silent film adaptation of Ben-Hur. Her other films include A Kiss for Cinderella, The Singing Fool, Sonny Boy and The Medicine Man.

name: Mary Brian
quote: The Sweetest Girl in Pictures.
description: an American actress and movie star. Mary effortlessly made the transition from silents to talkies in The Virginian (1929). One of her biggest hits was as Gwen Cavendish in the urbane comedy The Royal Family of Broadway (1930).

name: Marion Davies
quote: Hearst built more than one castle, and Marion was the hostess in all of them. The mistress was never one of Hearst's possessions: he was always her suitor, and she was the precious treasure of his heart for more than 30 years, until his last breath of life.
description: an American film actress, producer, screenwriter, and philanthropist. Davies was already building a solid reputation as a film comedian when newspaper tycoon William Randolph Hearst, with whom she had begun a romantic relationship, took over management of her career.

name: Eva Le Gallienne
quote: If you listen to Miss Le G., you can hear 15 shades of meaning in 15 syllables.
description: a British-born American stage actress, producer, director, translator, and author. A broadway star by age 21, Le Gallienne consciously ended her work on Broadway to devote herself to founding the Civic Repertory Theater, in which she was both director, producer, and lead actress.

name: Janet Gaynor
quote: She possessed the perfect combination of humor, charm, vulnerability, and innocence.
description: an American film, stage and television actress and painter. In 1926, she rose to fame and became one of the biggest box office draws of the era. She was the first winner of the Academy Award for Best Actress for 3 films: 7th Heaven, Sunrise: A Song of Two Humans, and Street Angel.

name: Colleen Moore
quote: I was the spark that lit up flaming youth, Colleen Moore was the torch. What little things we are to have caused all that trouble.
description: an American film actress who began her career during the silent film era. Moore became one of the most fashionable stars of the era and helped popularize the bobbed haircut. A huge star in her day, approximately half of Moore's films are now considered lost.

name: Norma Talmadge
quote: She is considered one of the foremost emotional actresses of the day, and is equally capable in light comedy and character roles. Because of her ability to excel in every branch of screen art, she has been universally nick-named 'The Queen of Versatility'.
description: an American actress and film producer of the silent era. A major box-office draw for more than a decade, her career reached a peak in the early 1920s. Her most famous film was Smilin' Through (1922), Secrets (1924) and The Lady (1925).

name: Bessie Smith
quote: The Empress of the Blues.
description: an American blues singer. Nicknamed the Empress of the Blues, she was the most popular female blues singer of the 1920s and 1930s. She is often regarded as one of the greatest singers of her era and was a major influence on other jazz singers.

name: Tamara de Lempicka
quote: My goal: never copy. Create a new style, with luminous and brilliant colors, rediscover the elegance of my models.
description: a Polish painter active in the 1920s and 1930s, who spent her working life in France and the United States. She is best-known for her polished Art-Deco portraits of aristocrats and the wealthy, and for her highly-stylized paintings of nudes.

name: Georgia O'Keeffe
quote: The most remarkable thing about O'Keefe was the audacity and uniqueness of her early work.
description: an American artist. O'Keeffe has been recognized as the ‘Mother of American modernism’. O'Keeffe was a legend beginning in the 1920s, known as much for her independent spirit and female role model, as for her dramatic and innovative works of art.

name: Nancy Cunard
quote: The vermilion wall receding as a sin beyond your moonstone whiteness, Your chiffon voice.
description: a writer, heiress and political activist. She was born into the British upper class and devoted much of her life to fighting racism and fascism. She became a muse to some of the 20th century's most distinguished writers and artists.

name: Zelda Fitzgerald
quote: Her surviving corpus of art represents the work of a talented, visionary woman who rose above tremendous odds to create a fascinating body of work - one that inspires us to celebrate the life that might have been.
description: an American socialite, novelist, painter and wife of author F. Scott Fitzgerald. Born in Montgomery, Alabama, she was noted for her beauty and high spirits. She and Scott became emblems of the Jazz Age, for which they are still celebrated.

name: Gertrude Ederle
quote: What power Ederle had, what a joy it must have been to see her in the water.
description: an American competition swimmer, Olympic champion, and former world record-holder in five events. On 6 August 1926, she became the first woman to swim across the English Channel. Among other nicknames, the press sometimes called her ‘Queen of the Waves’.

name: Jobyna Ralston
quote: Curly-locked, cherubic knockabout comedienne of the silent cinema.
description: an American stage and film actress. In 1923 she starred with silent comedian Harold Lloyd in Why Worry?, and for the next 5 years appeared in 6 of Lloyd's feature films. It is for these performances and her onscreen chemistry with Lloyd that she is best remembered today.

name: Lil Dagover
quote: Most of Lil Dagover's career and fate was linked to that of the German cinema, where her role was usually that of the frail, menaced heroine.
description: a German stage, film and television actress whose career spanned between 1913 and 1979. She was one of the most popular and recognized film actresses in the Weimar Republic.

name: Jane Winton
quote: The Green-eyed Goddess of Hollywood.
description: an American film actress, dancer, opera soprano, writer, and painter. During the 1920s she began her stage career as a dancer with the Ziegfeld Follies. After leaving Hollywood, Winton performed various operatic roles both in the United States and abroad.

name: Greta Garbo
quote: Her instinct, her mastery over the machine, was pure witchcraft. I cannot analyze this woman's acting. I only know that no one else so effectively worked in front of a camera.
description: a Swedish-born American film actress during the 1920s and 1930s. Garbo was nominated three times for the Academy Award for Best Actress. Many critics and film historians consider her performance as the doomed courtesan Marguerite Gautier in Camille (1936) to be her finest.

name: Claudette Colbert
quote: The mixture of inimitable beauty, sophistication, wit, and vivacity.
description: an American film actress. With her round apple-face, big eyes, charm, aristocratic manner, and flair for light comedy as well as emotional drama, Colbert was known for a versatility that led to her becoming one of the best-paid stars of the 1930s and 1940s.

name: Joan Crawford
quote: In the '30s, she embodied a Depression-era nation's hopes with her portrayals of both spunky working girls and glamorous society girls.
description: an American film and television actress who began her career as a dancer and stage showgirl. In the 1930s, Crawford's fame rivaled, and later outlasted, MGM colleagues Norma Shearer and Greta Garbo. Crawford often played hard-working young women who find romance and success.

name: Katharine Hepburn
quote: Confident, intelligent and witty, four-time Oscar winner Katharine Hepburn defied convention throughout her professional and personal life. Hepburn provided an image of an assertive woman whom [females] could watch and learn from.
description: an American actress. Known for her fierce independence and spirited personality, Hepburn was a leading lady in Hollywood for more than 60 years. She appeared in a range of genres, from screwball comedy to literary drama, and she received 4 Academy Awards for Best Actress.

name: Marlene Dietrich
quote: Whoever knows her and has been able to experience her has experienced perfection itself.
description: a German actress and singer. She successfully traded on her glamorous persona and ‘exotic’ looks, and became one of the highest-paid actresses of the era. Her most famous films include The Blue Angel (1930), Morocco (1930), Shanghai Express (1932) and Desire (1936).

name: Ann Dvorak
quote: With unconventional, yet striking good looks and an acting style that was raw and understated for the 1930s, she seemed destined to rise to the highest heights Warner Brothers had to offer. However, that immortality eluded Ann Dvorak.
description: an American stage and film actress. Known for her style and elegance, she was a popular leading lady for Warner Bros. during the 1930s, and appeared in numerous contemporary romances and melodramas: Three on a Match (1932), Love Is a Racket (1932), Sky Devils (1932).

name: Carole Lombard
quote: A natural prankster, a salty tongued straight-shooter, a feminist precursor and one of the few stars who was beloved by the technicians and studio functionaries who worked with her.
description: an American film actress. She was particularly noted for her energetic, often off-beat roles in the screwball comedies of the 1930s. She was the highest-paid star in Hollywood in the late 1930s. She was the third wife of actor Clark Gable.

name: Jean Harlow
quote: It doesn't matter what degree of talent she possesses ... nobody ever starved possessing what she's got.
description: an American film actress and sex symbol of the 1930s. She had become one of the biggest movie stars in the world by the late 1930s, often nicknamed the ’Blonde Bombshell’ and the ‘Platinum Blonde’. She was also popular for her ‘Laughing Vamp’ movie persona.

name: Bette Davis
quote: Even the most inconsiderable film ... seemed temporarily better than they were because of that precise, nervy voice, the pale ash-blond hair, the popping, neurotic eyes, a kind of corrupt and phosphorescent prettiness.
description: an American actress of film, television, and theater. Regarded as one of the greatest actresses in Hollywood history, she was noted for her willingness to play unsympathetic, sardonic characters. Until the late 1940s, she was one of American cinema's most celebrated leading ladies.

name: Vivien Leigh
quote: A stunner whose ravishing beauty often tended to obscure her staggering achievements as an actress.
description: an English stage and film actress. She won two Academy Awards for Best Actress, for her iconic performances as Scarlett O'Hara in Gone with the Wind (1939) and Blanche DuBois in the film version of A Streetcar Named Desire (1951).

name: Barbara Stanwyck
quote: That is the kind of woman that makes whole civilizations topple.
description: an American actress, model and dancer. She was a film and television star, known during her 60-year career as a consummate and versatile professional with a strong, realistic screen presence, and a favorite of directors including Cecil B. DeMille, Fritz Lang, and Frank Capra.

name: Irene Dunne
quote: She was, and is, a real lady. And a great star. They don't make them like her any more - and her beauty today is still unfaded.
description: an American film actress and singer of the 1930s and 1940s. Dunne was nominated five times for the Academy Award for Best Actress, for her performances in Cimarron (1931), Theodora Goes Wild (1936), The Awful Truth (1937), Love Affair (1939) and I Remember Mama (1948).

name: Mae West
quote: There was no doubt she was way ahead of her time with her sexual innuendos and how she made fun of a puritanical society. She did a lot to bring it out of the closet and perhaps we should be grateful for that.
description: an American actress, singer, playwright, screenwriter, comedian, and sex symbol. Known for her lighthearted bawdy double entendres, and breezy sexual independence, West made a name for herself on the stage before becoming a comedian, actress, and writer in the movie industry.

name: Myrna Loy
quote: Myrna Loy is one of those stars whose appeal is timeless. Across the decades, her beautiful eyes project a keen intelligence and self-assurance. This was no illusion.
description: an American film, television and stage actress. She was originally typecast in exotic roles, often as a vamp or a woman of Asian descent, but her career prospects improved greatly following her portrayal of Nora Charles in The Thin Man (1934).

name: Ginger Rogers
quote: Sure Astaire was great, but don't forget that Ginger Rogers did everything he did... backwards and in high heels.
description: an American actress, dancer, and singer, widely known for performing in films and RKO's musical films, partnered with Fred Astaire. Throughout the 1930s, Rogers made 10 films with Astaire, among which were some of her biggest successes, such as Swing Time and Top Hat.

name: Dorothy Lamour
quote: Hollywood's 'sarong girl' Dorothy Lamour made no claims to be a great actress, but few stars of the screen's vintage years are regarded with greater affection.
description: an American actress and singer. She is best remembered for appearing in the Road to... movies, a series of successful comedies. Her appearance as Ulah in The Jungle Princess brought her fame and marked the beginning of her image as the ‘Sarong Queen’.

name: Olivia de Havilland
quote: Her playing is thoughtful, quiet, detailed, and well sustained, and since it is founded, as some more talented playing is not, in an unusually healthful-seeming and likable temperament, it is an undivided pleasure to see.
description: a British-American actress. She is best known for her early screen performances in The Adventures of Robin Hood (1938) and Gone with the Wind (1939), and her later award-winning performances in To Each His Own (1946), The Snake Pit (1948), and The Heiress (1949).

name: Merle Oberon
quote: The exotic and glamorous Merle Oberon ranked among the most striking performers during the early years of sound cinema in Britain.
description: an Anglo-Indian actress. She began her film career in British films as Anne Boleyn in The Private Life of Henry VIII (1933). She was nominated for an Academy Award for Best Actress for her performance in The Dark Angel (1935).

name: Maureen O'Sullivan
quote: The delicately beautiful Ireland's first film star.
description: an Irish actress best known for playing Jane in the Tarzan series of films starring Johnny Weissmuller. She starred in The Thin Man and played Kitty in Anna Karenina. After co-starring with the Marx Bros in A Day At The Races, she appeared as Molly Beaumont in A Yank at Oxford.

name: Shirley Temple
quote: With her bright smile, mop of blond curls and unwavering exuberance, Shirley Jane Temple sang, danced and acted her way into the hearts of the movie-going public during the Great Depression and beyond.
description: an American actress, singer, dancer, businesswoman, and diplomat who was Hollywood's number one box-office draw as a child actress from 1935 to 1938. As an adult, she was named United States ambassador to Ghana and to Czechoslovakia.

name: Rita Hayworth
quote: The Love Goddess.
description: an American actress and dancer. She achieved fame during the 1940s as one of the era's top stars. She was the top pin-up girl for GIs during WWII. Hayworth is perhaps best known for her performance in the 1946 film noir, Gilda, and her greatest success was in the Cover Girl (1944).

name: Lauren Bacall
quote: People said Bacall was 'tough.' She's a pussycat with a heart of gold.
description: an American actress and singer known for her distinctive voice and sultry looks. She is famous for her films with Humphrey Bogart such as To Have and Have Not, The Big Sleep, Dark Passage, Key Largo, and also for roles in How to Marry a Millionaire and Designing Woman.

name: Lucile Ball
quote: Lucille Ball, the leggy showgirl, model and B-grade movie queen whose pumpkin hair and genius for comedy made her an icon of television.
description: an American actress, comedian, model, film-studio executive, and producer. She was best known as the star of the self-produced sitcoms I Love Lucy, The Lucy-Desi Comedy Hour, The Lucy Show, and Here's Lucy.

name: Ingrid Bergman
quote: She has greater versatility than any actress on the American screen ... her roles have demanded an adaptability and sensitiveness of characterization to which few actresses could rise.
description: a Swedish actress who starred in a variety of European and American films. In the USA, she is considered to have brought a ‘Nordic freshness and vitality’ to the screen, along with exceptional beauty and intelligence.  She is best remembered for her roles in Casablanca and in Notorious.

name: Vivian Blaine
quote: I put all my intelligence, such as it is, into playing dumb blondes.
description: an American actress and singer, best known for originating the role of Miss Adelaide in the musical theater production of Guys and Dolls, as well as appearing in the film version. She is also starred in Jitterbugs, Greenwich Village, Something for the Boys, Nob Hill, and State Fair.

name: Paulette Goddard
quote: A vivacious film actress adept at playing both sophisticated comedy and sultry melodrama, known for her spirited persona and for her association with Charlie Chaplin.
description: an American actress, a child fashion model and a performer in several Broadway productions as a Ziegfeld Girl, she became a major star in the 1940s. Her most notable films were her first major role, as Charlie Chaplin's leading lady in Modern Times, and The Great Dictator.

name: Betty Grable
quote: That platinum blond, blue-eyed Hollywood starlet had a set of gams that inspired American soldiers, sailors, airmen and Marines to set forth to save civilization from the Axis powers.
description: an American actress, pin-up girl, dancer, and singer. She replaced Alice Faye in Down Argentine Way (1940), and became Fox's biggest film star throughout the 1940s. Two of her biggest film successes were the musical Mother Wore Tights and the comedy How to Marry a Millionaire.

name: Veronica Lake
quote: An icy blonde whose trademark hairstyle - a cascade of golden tresses that obscured one heavy-lidded eye - remained among the enduring images of Hollywood glamour, Veronica Lake was for a time, one of the most popular actresses in motion pictures.
description: an American film, stage, and television actress. Lake won both popular and critical acclaim for her role in Sullivan's Travels and for femme fatale roles in film noirs with Alan Ladd, during the 1940s. She was also well known for her peek-a-boo hairstyle.

name: Hedy Lamarr
quote: She was stunning, to be sure, her beauty coupling well with a sensual mystique and a gift for acting, but was also a brilliant inventor who made movies by day and labored over pet inventions by night.
description: an Austrian-born American film actress and inventor. At the beginning of WWII, Lamarr and composer George Antheil developed a radio guidance system for Allied torpedoes. She also appeared in Algiers, I Take This Woman, Comrade X, Come Live With Me, and Samson and Delilah.

name: June Lockhart
quote: If America had a Mom, she would probably be June Lockhart. Few can convey maternal munificence with the conviction of this ever perky, poised and pretty player of stage, film and especially TV.
description: an American actress, primarily in 1950s and 1960s television, also with performances on stage and in film. On two television series she played mother roles, Lassie and Lost in Space. She also played in Meet Me in St. Louis, Sergeant York, All This, and Heaven Too and The Yearling.

name: Ida Lupino
quote: She was stubborn, sullen, tiny and resilient. With a mink thrust over her shoulder-pads and an orchid in her hair, Ida Lupino made it clear - in a silky, querulous voice - that she resented living in a man's world.
description: an Anglo-American actress and singer, who became a pioneering director and producer. With her independent production company, she co-wrote and co-produced several of her own social-message films, and was the first woman to direct a film noir, The Hitch-Hiker, in 1953.

name: Carmen Miranda
quote: The Brazilian Bombshell, The Lady in the Tutti-Frutti Hat.
description: a Portuguese-born Brazilian samba singer, dancer, Broadway actress, and film star who was popular from the 1930s to the 1950s. Nicknamed ‘The Brazilian Bombshell’, Miranda is noted for her signature fruit hat outfit she wore in her American films.

name: Lizabeth Scott
quote: The most beautiful face of film noir during the 1940s and 1950s.
description: an American actress, known for her ‘smoky voice’ and being ‘the most beautiful face of film noir during the 1940s and 1950s’. She emerged in such films as The Strange Love of Martha Ivers (1946), Dead Reckoning (1947), Desert Fury (1947), and Too Late for Tears (1949).

name: Gene Tierney
quote: With prominent cheekbones and the most appealing overbite of her day, her striking good looks helped propel her to stardom.
description: an American film and stage actress. Acclaimed as a great beauty, she became established as a leading lady. Tierney was best known for her portrayal of the title character in the film Laura, and was nominated for an Oscar for Best Actress for her role in Leave Her to Heaven.

name: Jane Wyman
quote: I won this award for keeping my mouth shut, so I think I'll do it again now.
description: an American actress, singer, dancer and philanthropist whose career spanned seven decades. She was also the first wife of actor Ronald Reagan, the 40th President of the United States. Her films include Public Wedding, Brother Rat, Bad Men of Missouri, Stage Fright, and So Big.

name: Vera Lynn
quote: The 'Forces' Sweetheart' who helped keep morale high amongst British troops and those on the home front during World War II.
description: an English singer of traditional pop, songwriter and actress, whose musical recordings and performances were enormously popular during the Second World War. The songs most associated with her are ‘We'll Meet Again’, ‘The White Cliffs of Dover’, and ‘There'll Always Be an England’.

name: Ella Fitzgerald
quote: The First Lady of Song and the Queen of Jazz.
description: an American jazz singer often referred to as the First Lady of Song, Queen of Jazz and Lady Ella. She was noted for her purity of tone, impeccable diction, phrasing and intonation, and a ‘horn-like’ improvisational ability, particularly in her scat singing.

name: Edith Piaf
quote: When one thinks of Edith Piaf, one thinks of love, sorrow and music. One did not breathe without the other two.
description: a French cabaret singer, songwriter, and actress who became widely regarded as France's national chanteuse, as well as being one of France's greatest international stars. Among her well-known songs are ‘La Vie en rose’, ‘Non, je ne regrette rien’, ‘Milord’, and ‘Padam ... Padam ’.

name: Kate Smith
quote: The Songbird of the South.
description: an American singer, a contralto, best known for her rendition of Irving Berlin's ‘God Bless America’. Smith became known as The Songbird of the South after her enduring popularity during World War II and contribution to American culture and patriotism.

name: Jennifer Jones
quote: A brunette beauty with apple cheeks and luminous brown eyes, Jennifer Jones was a sensitive actress with a screen persona that combined shy vulnerability and bold emotion. She was equally convincing as saint or sinner.
description: an American actress during Hollywood's golden years. Jones won the Academy Award for Best Actress for her performance in The Song of Bernadette (1943). Her other notable films include Duel in the Sun,  Since You Went Away, Love Letters, Cluny Brown, Portrait of Jennie.

name: Elizabeth Taylor
quote: She had the range, nerve, and instinct that only Bette Davis had had before - and like Davis, Taylor was monster and empress, sweetheart and scold, idiot and wise woman.
description: a British-American actress, businesswoman, and humanitarian. She began her career as a child actress in the early 1940s (‘National Velvet’), and was one of the most popular stars of classical Hollywood cinema in the 1950s (‘Father of the Bride’, ‘A Place in the Sun’).

name: Dorothy Dandridge
quote: In both her life and her films Dorothy Dandridge was given the opportunity to play only one role, that of the so-called 'tragic mulatto', in which a beautiful, sensuous, light-skinned black woman is doomed to a life of unhappiness.
description: an American film and theatre actress, singer, and dancer. She is perhaps best known for being the first African-American actress to be nominated for an Academy Award for Best Actress for her performance in the 1954 film Carmen Jones.

name: Marilyn Monroe
quote: I shall never forget the almost overpowering feeling of unconquerable strength and sweetness which she conveyed. I had all the wild nature of Africa amicably gazing at me with mighty playfulness.
description: an American actress, model and singer. Famous for playing comic ‘dumb blonde’ characters, she became one of the most popular sex symbols of the 1950s and was emblematic of the era's attitudes towards sexuality. Famous films: Niagara, Gentlemen Prefer Blondes.

name: Sandra Dee
quote: A reigning teen star of the late 1950s and early 60s, whose pert innocence and saucy yet virginal sweetness struck a nerve with the pre-sexual revolution's youth audience.
description: an American actress. Best known for her portrayal of ingénues, Dee earned a Golden Globe Award as one of the year's most promising newcomers for her performance in Until They Sail. She became a teenage star for her subsequent performances in Imitation of Life and Gidget.

name: Anne Francis
quote: A statuesque blonde who was distinguished by a prominent beauty mark near her mouth and whose movie and television roles ranged from a wide-eyed innocent to a provocative femme fatale.
description: an American actress known for her role in the science fiction film Forbidden Planet (1956) and for having starred in the television series Honey West (1965-1966) which was the first TV series with a female detective character's name in the title.

name: Ava Gardner
quote: One of the most beautiful women of her day  who, despite her renowned beauty and sensuality, successfully resisted being typecast as a sex symbol.
description: an American actress and singer. She drew attention with her performance in The Killers (1946) and was nominated for the Academy Award for Best Actress for her work in Mogambo (1953), also receiving BAFTA Award and Golden Globe Award nominations for other films.

name: Susan Hayward
quote: I never thought of myself as a movie star. I'm just a working girl. A working girl who worked her way to the top--and never fell off.
description: an American actress. She achieved recognition for her dramatic abilities with the 5 Oscar nominations for Best Actress for her performance in Smash-Up, the Story of a Woman, My Foolish Heart, With a Song in My Heart, I'll Cry Tomorrow. She finally won the Oscar for ‘I Want to Live!’.

name: Audrey Hepburn
quote: She is like a portrait by Modigliani where the various distortions are not only interesting in themselves but make a completely satisfying composite.
description: a British actress, model, dancer and humanitarian. Recognised as a film and fashion icon, Hepburn was active during Hollywood's Golden Age. She shot to stardom for playing the lead role in Roman Holiday. Her other films include Sabrina, Breakfast at Tiffany's, Charade, My Fair Lady.

name: Judy Holliday
quote: She was noted for her distinctive voice and her warm, intelligent portrayal of funny and endearing 'dumb blondes' onstage and in film.
description: an American actress, comedian, and singer. Her success in the 1946 stage production of Born Yesterday as ‘Billie Dawn’ led to her being cast in the 1950 film version for which she won an Academy Award and a Golden Globe Award for Best Actress.

name: Grace Kelly
quote: Grace Kelly's rare beauty and stunning self-possession propelled her into the Hollywood pantheon, onto the Best-Dressed List, and ultimately to Monaco's royal palace.
description: an American actress who became Princess of Monaco after marrying Prince Rainier III, in 1956. In 1953, she gained stardom from her performance in the film Mogambo. Subsequently, she had leading roles in The Country Girl, High Noon, Dial M for Murder, Rear Window.

name: Deborah Kerr
quote: An artist of impeccable grace and beauty, a dedicated actress whose motion picture career has always stood for perfection, discipline and elegance.
description: a Scottish film, theatre and television actress. During her career, she won a Golden Globe for her performance as Anna Leonowens in the motion picture The King and I (1956) and the Sarah Siddons Award for her performance as Laura Reynolds in the play Tea and Sympathy.

name: Janet Leigh
quote: The actress who turned the mundane act of getting clean in a shower into one of cinema's most enduring images of gore and horror.
description: an American actress, singer, dancer and author. She played mostly dramatic roles during the latter half of the 1950s, in such films as Safari (1956) and Touch of Evil (1958), but achieved her most lasting recognition as the doomed Marion Crane in Alfred Hitchcock's Psycho (1960).

name: Jayne Mansfield
quote: The Working Man's Monroe, The Smartest Dumb Blonde.
description: an American film, theater, and television actress. She was also a nightclub entertainer, a singer, and one of the early Playboy Playmates. She was a major Hollywood sex symbol during the 1950s and early 1960s, and one of 20th Century Fox's main sex-symbol actresses.

name: Giulietta Masina
quote: The adjective which has been over-used to describe Giulietta Masina is 'Chaplinesque', as she laughed through the tears which cascaded down her clown's face. There had been no female star before quite like her.
description: an Italian film and stage actress. She starred in La Strada and Nights of Cabiria. Masina won the Best Actress award at the 1957 Cannes Film Festival for the latter film. She was the wife and muse of the Italian film director Federico Fellini, in whom she found an artistic equal.

name: Kim Novak
quote: Kim Novak was among Hollywood's most enigmatic sex symbols of the '50s and early '60s. Blonde and beautiful, she exuded a daunting intellectual chilliness and an underlying passionate heat that made her especially alluring.
description: an American film and television actress. She starred in such popular successes as Picnic, The Man with the Golden Arm and Pal Joey. However, she is perhaps best known today for her performance as Madeline Elster/Judy Barton in Alfred Hitchcock's classic thriller Vertigo.

name: Debbie Reynolds
quote: The vivacious blonde, who had a wholesome girl-next-door look which was coupled with a no-nonsense attitude in her roles.
description: an American actress, singer, businesswoman, film historian, humanitarian, and mother of the actress and writer Carrie Fisher. She was nominated for the Golden Globe Award for her portrayal of Helen Kane in Three Little Words, and her breakout role was in Singin' in the Rain.

name: Thelma Ritter
quote: With her salty humor, crackling New York accent and seen-it-all demeanor, Thelma Ritter was one of the most accomplished and dependable character actresses in American film.
description: an American actress, best known for her comedic roles as working class characters and her strong New York accent. She received 6 Academy Award nominations for Best Supporting Actress and won Tony Award for Best Leading Actress in a Musical.

name: Jane Russell
quote: There had been previous icons of sexuality, but the beautiful, well-endowed, and photogenic Jane Russell may have been the first woman sought out and hired specifically to be a sex symbol.
description: an American film actress and one of Hollywood's leading sex symbols in the 1940s and 1950s. In 1947, Russell delved into music before returning to films. After starring in multiple films in the 1950s, Russell again returned to music while completing several other films in the 1960s.

name: Eva Marie Saint
quote: Although she is seemingly a hard, designing type, she also emerges both the sweet heroine and a glamorous charmer.
description: an American actress and producer. In a career spanning 70 years, she is known for starring in Elia Kazan's On the Waterfront (1954), for which she won an Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress, and Alfred Hitchcock's North by Northwest (1959).

name: Kim Stanley
quote: Anyone who saw her on stage during her ten-year Broadway heyday still raves about her frayed immediacy and her predilection for unearthing the most painful emotions.
description: an American actress, primarily in television and theatre, but with occasional film performances. She received the 1952 Theatre World Award for her role in The Chase (1952), and starred in the Broadway productions of Picnic (1953) and Bus Stop (1955).

name: Sophia Loren
quote: Beauty is how you feel inside, and it reflects in your eyes. It is not something physical.
description: an Italian film actress and singer. Her talents as an actress were not recognized until her performance as Cesira in Vittorio De Sica's Two Women. Sophia remained a bona fide international movie star throughout the sixties and seventies, making films on both sides of the Atlantic.

name: Brigitte Bardot
quote: The archetypal sex kitten, Brigitte Bardot was the first foreign-language star ever to attain a level of international success comparable to America's most popular homegrown talents.
description: a French actress, singer, dancer and fashion model, who later became an animal rights activist. She was one of the best known sex symbols of the 1950s and 1960s. She became world-famous in 1957 after starring in the controversial film And God Created Woman.

name: Natalie Wood
quote: The Most Beautiful Teenager in the World.
description: an American film and television actress. She was known for her screen roles in Miracle on 34th Street, Splendor in the Grass, Rebel Without a Cause, The Searchers, and West Side Story. She first worked in films as a child, then became a Hollywood star as a young adult.

name: Catherine Deneuve
quote: A model of Gallic elegance, cultivated lust object for art house filmgoers everywhere, and one of the best-respected actresses in the French film industry.
description: a French actress as well as an occasional singer, model and producer. She gained recognition for her portrayal of aloof, mysterious beauties for various directors, including Luis Buñuel, François Truffaut and Roman Polanski.

name: Jane Fonda
quote: Brilliant, beautiful, achingly vulnerable, selfwounding, Fonda is one of the greatest film stars to ever appear on the screen.
description: an American actress, writer, political activist, former fashion model and fitness guru. She rose to fame in 1960s films such as Period of Adjustment (1962), Walk on the Wild Side (1962), Sunday in New York (1963), Cat Ballou (1965), Barefoot in the Park (1967) and Barbarella (1968).

name: Julie Christie
quote: The most poetic of all actresses.
description: an English actress. An icon of the ‘swinging London’ era of the 1960s, she came to international attention for her performances in Darling (1965), for which she won the Academy Award for Best Actress, and Doctor Zhivago (also 1965), the eighth highest-grossing film of all time.

name: Claudia Cardinale
quote: Though lesser known in the States, Claudia Cardinale embodied all the wow factors of a 60s starlet: big hair, cat eyes, a seamless hourglass figure, and a raspy, unforgettable voice.
description: an Italian Tunisian film actress and sex symbol who appeared in some of the most acclaimed European films of the 1960s and 1970s, mainly Italian or French (Leopard, Cartouche, 8½), but also in several English films (The Pink Panther, Blindfold, Once Upon a Time in the West).

name: Ursula Andress
quote: When Ursula Andress emerged from the ocean in Dr. No, tossing two conch shells to the shore and shaking the water from her hair, the world took notice.
description: a Swiss film and television actress, former model and sex symbol, who has appeared in American, British and Italian films. She is best known for her breakthrough role as Bond girl Honey Ryder in the first James Bond film, Dr. No. She later starred as Vesper Lynd in Casino Royale.

name: Joanne Woodward
quote: Woodward had a palpable abhorrence to actually being a star - a determination that drove her to excel as a performer first instead of relying solely on her striking appearance.
description: an American actress, producer, activist, and philanthropist. Woodward had starred in The Three Faces of Eve (1957), for which she won the 1957 Academy Award for Best Actress. She appeared with husband Paul Newman in ten feature films.

name: Geraldine Page
quote: One of the greatest American actresses of all time, Geraldine Page was a master craftswoman who seemed to bring out the most inner detail of the character she was playing.
description: an American film, television and stage actress. An eight-time Academy Award nominee, she was nominated for Hondo, Summer and Smoke, Sweet Bird of Youth, You're a Big Boy Now, Pete 'n' Tillie, Interiors and The Pope of Greenwich Village, before winning for The Trip to Bountiful.

name: Anna Karina
quote: One of the screen's great beauties and an enduring symbol of the French New Wave.
description: a Danish-French film actress, director and screenwriter, who was known as a muse in the 1960s of the director Jean-Luc Godard, one of the pioneers of the French New Wave. Their collaborations include The Little Soldier, A Woman Is a Woman, Vivre sa vie, Band of Outsiders.

name: Anouk Aimee
quote: Anouk Aimee is perhaps best known for her remarkable presence as an icon of cool, sophisticated beauty.
description: a French film actress, who has appeared in 70 films since 1947, acting in Federico Fellini's La Dolce Vita and 8½, Jacques Demy's Lola, George Cukor’s Justine, Bernardo Bertolucci's Tragedy of a Ridiculous Man  and Robert Altman's Prêt à Porter.

name: Shirley MacLaine
quote: Outspoken American actress and dancer known for her deft portrayals of charmingly eccentric characters and for her interest in mysticism and reincarnation.
description: an American film, television and theater actress, singer, dancer, activist and author. She is known for her New Age beliefs, and has an interest in spirituality and reincarnation. Her famous films include Some Came Running, The Apartment, The Turning Point, and Terms of Endearment.

name: Raquel Welch
quote: A new reigning 1960s international sex symbol took to the cinematic throne as soon as Raquel Welch emerged from the sea in her purposely depleted, furry prehistoric bikini.
description: an American actress and singer. Welch's unique persona on film made her into an icon of the 1960s and 1970s. She carved out a place in movie history portraying strong female characters and breaking the mold of the submissive sex symbol.

name: Tina Louise
quote: Titian-haired' is the manner in which actress Tina Louise is usually described. Despite her numerous comic performances, she prefers to be regarded as a serious actress.
description: an American author, singer and actress probably most famous for, from 1964 to 1967, portraying movie star Ginger Grant in the CBS situation comedy, Gilligan's Island. Louise had starring roles in a number of Hollywood movies, including The Trap, The Hangman, Day of the Outlaw.

name: Carolyn Jones
quote: The pluck and courage that lady has is amazing.  She gave joy to the world.
description: an American actress of television and film. Jones began her film career in the early 1950s, and by the end of the decade had achieved critical recognition with a role in The Bachelor Party (1957). In 1964, she began playing the role of Morticia Addams in the original Addams Family.

name: Melina Mercouri
quote: A many-sided and vibrant personality, she played a leading role in the struggle against the Colonel's Junta in 1967-1974 and was a great theatre and film actress of international fame.
description: a Greek actress, singer and politician. A many-sided and vibrant personality, she played a leading role in the struggle against the Colonel's Junta in 1967 - 1974 and was a great theatre and film actress of international fame.

name: Irene Papas
quote: Her unusual beauty is not the sort that superstar actresses like to compete with,  all the same, her presence in many well-known movies inspired something of a cult.
description: a Greek actress and occasional singer, who has starred in over 70 films in a career spanning more than 50 years. She became famous in Greece, and then an international star of feature films such as The Guns of Navarone and Zorba the Greek.

name: Jeanne Moreau
quote: With her sensual, pouting mouth, her Gauloises-saturated voice, and her combination of sharp intelligence and smouldering sexuality, Jeanne Moreau seemed to many the embodiment of French womanhood.
description: a French actress, singer, screenwriter and director. She won the Cannes Film Festival Award for Best Actress for Seven Days... Seven Nights, the BAFTA Award for Best Foreign Actress for Viva Maria!, and the César Award for Best Actress for The Old Lady Who Walked in the Sea.

name: Liv Ullmann
quote: Liv, you are my Stradivarius.
description: a Norwegian actress and film director. She is known as one of the ‘muses’ of Swedish director Ingmar Bergman. Ullmann won a Golden Globe Award for Best Actress for the film The Emigrants. Her other critically acclaimed films include Scenes from a Marriage and Face to Face.

name: Diane Keaton
quote: Perhaps no living actress possesses more cinematic cool than Diane Keaton. She is sharp-witted, self-deprecating, neurotic and insightful. In short, Keaton is the thinking person’s movie star.
description: an American film actress, director and producer. Her first major film role was as Kay Adams-Corleone in The Godfather, but the films that shaped her early career were those with Woody Allen. Most famous films include Annie Hall, Reds, Marvin's Room and Something's Gotta Give.

name: Talia Shire
quote: I liked making Rocky more than anything I’ve done. It’s a positive film, and there aren’t many of those around anymore.
description: an American actress best known for her roles as Connie Corleone in The Godfather films and Adrian Balboa in the Rocky series. For her work in The Godfather Part II and Rocky, Shire was nominated for two Academy Awards for Best Supporting Actress and Best Actress.

name: Faye Dunaway
quote: Though fiercely modern, an ideal female analog for screen machos like young Jack Nicholson, she also radiated the stuff vintage movie stars are made of. Any actress today would be lucky to have a fraction of her films on her resume.
description: an American actress. Her most notable films include Bonnie and Clyde, The Thomas Crown Affair, the drama The Arrangement, the revisionist western Little Big Man, The Three Musketeers, the neo-noir mystery Chinatown, The Towering Inferno, and Three Days of the Condor.

name: Madeline Kahn
quote: Madeline Kahn was a comic legend who could do anything with her voice. She can be distracted, confused and preoccupied, often at the same time, without ever losing focus, without ever losing funny.
description: an American actress, comedienne, voice actress, and singer, known for comedic roles in films directed by Peter Bogdanovich and Mel Brooks, including What's Up, Doc?, Young Frankenstein, High Anxiety, and her Oscar nominated roles in Paper Moon and Blazing Saddles.

name: Shelley Duvall
quote: Shelley Duvall's blood-curdling screams of terror in the climax of The Shining are an indelible part of film history.
description: an American former actress, producer, writer, singer, and comedian. Duvall began her career appearing in various Robert Altman films in the 1970s and had a supporting role in Annie Hall before starring in lead roles in Popeye and The Shining.

name: Ellen Burstyn
quote: In a remarkable six-decade career, Ellen Burstyn has gone from leading light of the New American Cinema to one of the grand dames of Hollywood. Her complex, fully lived-in characters are models of superbly judged, wholly committed screen acting.
description: an American actress. Her performance in the acclaimed The Last Picture Show brought her Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress. Burstyn received an Oscar nomination for her lead performance in The Exorcist, and won in the same nomination for Alice Doesn't Live Here Anymore.

name: Meryl Streep
quote: A luminous blonde with nearly translucent pale skin, intelligent blue eyes, and an elegant facial bone structure, Streep sustains a fragile, fleeting beauty that allows her to travel the spectrum between earthily plain, and ethereally glamorous and radiant.
description: an American actress and philanthropist, she is particularly known for versatility in her roles and accent adaptation. Streep went on to win Best Supporting Actress for Kramer vs. Kramer (1979), and Best Actress for Sophie's Choice (1982) and The Iron Lady (2011).

name: Carol Kane
quote: I don't put together cars, I put together people. It makes me happy to construct these people, to build another world. I feel happy and free and very consumed.
description: an American stage, screen and television actress and comedian. She became known in the 1970s in films such as Hester Street (for which she received an Academy Award nomination) and Annie Hall. She also appeared on the television series Taxi in the early 1980s.

name: Barbra Streisand
quote: The first major female star to command roles as a Jewish actress, Streisand redefined female stardom in the 1960s and ‘70s with her sensitive portrayal of ethnic urban characters. Her immense popularity matched only by her outspokenness.
description: an American singer, songwriter, actress, and filmmaker. In a career spanning 6 decades, she starred in the critically acclaimed Funny Girl, for which she won the Oscar and Golden Globe for Best Actress. Her other films include The Owl and the Pussycat, The Way We Were, A Star Is Born.

name: Olivia Newton-John
quote: Olivia Newton-John skillfully made the transition from popular country-pop singer to popular mainstream soft rock singer, becoming one of the most successful vocalists of the '70s in the process.
description: an English-Australian singer, songwriter, actress, entrepreneur, and activist. She has sold an estimated 100 million records, making her one of the world's best-selling artists of all time. She starred in the musical film Grease, and its soundtrack is one of the most successful in history.

name: Dolly Parton
quote: Dolly Parton always had talent to burn - a wonderful singer, brilliant songwriter, inspired businesswoman, accomplished actress and natural comedienne.
description: an American singer, songwriter, multi-instrumentalist, record producer, actress, author, businesswoman, and philanthropist, known primarily for her work in country music. She has composed over 3,000 songs, notably ‘I Will Always Love You’, ‘Jolene’, ‘Coat of Many Colors’, and ‘9 to 5’.

name: Cher
quote: She’s strong and comedic and incredibly brave, but shows vulnerability. I think she’s the epitome of rock & roll.
description: an American singer and actress. Sometimes called the Goddess of Pop, she is known for her distinctive contralto singing voice and for having worked in numerous areas of entertainment, as well as adopting a variety of styles and appearances during her six-decade-long career.

name: Sissy Spacek
quote: Strawberry blonde, freckle-faced, and willowy, Sissy Spacek was among the most popular female stars of the late '70s and '80s.
description: an American actress and singer. Her major breakthrough came in 1976 when she played the title character of Carrie White in Brian De Palma's horror film Carrie. Her other notable films include Coal Miner's Daughter,  Missing, The River, Crimes of the Heart, and In the Bedroom.

name: Isabelle Huppert
quote: One of the most enduring and respected actresses in French cinema, Isabelle Huppert is known for her versatile portrayals of characters ranging from the innocent to the sultry to the comic.
description: a French actress who has appeared in more than 110 films since her debut in 1971. She is the most nominated actress for the César Award, with 16 nominations. She twice won the César Award for Best Actress, for La Cérémonie (1995) and for Elle (2016).

name: Goldie Hawn
quote: Plucked from the chorus line, she made her name on television as a giggling, wide-eyed blonde with an endearing tendency to fluff her lines. But she used her position as America's premier ditz to become truly powerful.
description: an American actress, director, producer, and occasional singer. She rose to fame on the NBC sketch comedy program Rowan & Martin's Laugh-In. Hawn appeared in films such as Cactus Flower, There’s a Girl in My Soup, Butterflies Are Free, The Sugarland Express, Shampoo, Foul Play.

name: Susan Sarandon
quote: Simply by growing old gracefully, Susan Sarandon has defied the rules of Hollywood stardom: ultimately, she has come to embody an all-too-rare movie type -- the strong and sexy older woman.
description: an American actress and activist. She is an Academy Award and BAFTA Award winner who is also known for her social and political activism for a variety of causes. Her famous films include Atlantic City, Thelma & Louise, Lorenzo's Oil, The Client, and Dead Man Walking.

name: Charlotte Rampling
quote: Charlotte Rampling  possesses a chilling beauty - partly it’s those chiselled cheekbones, rivalled in ferocity by that hooded, penetrating gaze. But it’s her imperial, impenetrable presence that is undeniably her greatest weapon.
description: an English actress, model and singer, known for her work in European arthouse films: English (Georgy Girl, Verdict), French, and Italian (The Damned, The Night Porter). An icon of the Swinging Sixties, she began her career as a model and later became a fashion icon and muse.

name: Maggie Smith
quote: Breathes there a theatergoer or film fan on Earth who has not, at one time or another, fallen in love with the sublimely brilliant British comedic actress Dame Maggie Smith?
description: an English actress. She has had an extensive, varied career on stage, film and television. Smith has appeared in over 50 films and is one of Britain's most recognizable actresses. Her famous films: Nowhere to Go, The Prime of Miss Jean Brodie, California Suite and Harry Potter.

name: Maria Schneider
quote: She was a voluptuous, 19-year-old newcomer with long, curly brown hair framing a youthful face when she was cast in writer-director Bernardo Bertolucci's 'Last Tango in Paris'.
description: a French actress. At age 19 she became famous for portraying Jeanne opposite Marlon Brando in Bernardo Bertolucci's film Last Tango in Paris (1972) and the Girl in Michelangelo Antonioni's The Passenger (1975), opposite Jack Nicholson.

name: Mia Farrow
quote: She was creative. She had good range, she could do broad comedy as well as very serious parts. As a performer I have only good things to say about her, and I always thought she was neglected in terms of her approbation.
description: an American actress, activist, and former fashion model. Her most famous films include Rosemary's Baby, John and Mary, The Great Gatsby, and Death on the Nile. Farrow was in a relationship with Woody Allen from 1979 to 1992 and appeared in 13 of his 14 films over that period.

name: Carrie Fisher
quote: She was extremely smart: a talented actress, writer and comedienne with a very colorful personality that everyone loved. In Star Wars she was our great and powerful princess - feisty, wise and full of hope in a role that was more difficult than most people might think.
description: an American actress, writer, and humorist. Fisher was known for playing Princess Leia in the Star Wars films. Her other film credits included Shampoo, The Blues Brothers, Hannah and Her Sisters, The 'Burbs, When Harry Met Sally... , Soapdish, and The Women.

name: Sigourney Weaver
quote: The Sci-Fi Queen.
description: an American actress. Following her film debut as a minor character in Annie Hall, she quickly came to prominence with her first lead role as Ellen Ripley in Alien. She reprised the role in three sequels and is also known for her starring roles in box-office hits Ghostbusters and Avatar.

name: Barbara Hershey
quote: While a prolific screen presence from the late-'60s onward, Barbara Hershey did not truly attain star status until two decades later, finally blossoming to become one of the most acclaimed American actresses of her generation.
description: an American actress. In a career spanning nearly 50 years, she has played a variety of roles on television and in cinema in several genres. Her films include The Last Temptation of Christ, Portrait of a Lady, Shy People, A World Apart and Hannah and Her Sisters.

name: Brigitte Nielsen
quote: Statuesque and exotic, Brigitte Nielsen acted alongside the biggest names in Hollywood during her 1980s heyday as an icy villainess.
description: a Danish-Italian actress, model, singer and reality television personality who began her career modelling for Greg Gorman and Helmut Newton and several years later acted in the 1985 films Red Sonja and Rocky IV. She is also known for her marriage to Sylvester Stallone.

name: Kim Basinger
quote: Blonde, with full sensuous lips and a certain subtle luminescence to her skin, she projects an air of sexuality mixed with an almost childlike vulnerability that reminds some viewers of Marilyn Monroe.
description: an American actress, singer and former fashion model. Her notable films include L.A. Confidential, Never Say Never Again, The Natural, 9½ Weeks, and Batman. For her role in L.A. Confidential, she also won the Golden Globe for Best Supporting Actress.

name: Melanie Griffith
quote: Casting directors were impressed by her beauty, mesmerizing childlike voice and haunting onscreen vulnerability.
description: an American actress. Griffith began her career as an adolescent in nonspeaking film roles before making her credited debut opposite Gene Hackman in Arthur Penn's Night Moves. Her famous films include Brian De Palma's Body Double, Something Wild, Buffalo Girls, RKO 281.

name: Brooke Shields
quote: Young Brooke Shields found herself in the precarious position of simultaneously being idolized as a late-'70s icon of adolescent wholesome virginal innocence and being constantly photographed in manners verging on the mildly pornographic.
description: an American actress and model. Shields garnered widespread notoriety in in Louis Malle's film Pretty Baby at age 12, and she continued to model into her late teenage years and starred in several dramas in the 1980s, including The Blue Lagoon, and Franco Zeffirelli's Endless Love.

name: Juliette Binoche
quote: An international star of extraordinary, almost otherworldly beauty, who has received much international acclaim for the sensitivity and emotional maturity with which she portrays complex roles on screen and stage.
description: a French actress, artist and dancer. Her sensual performance in her English-language debut The Unbearable Lightness of Being, directed by Philip Kaufman, launched her international career. Her films include Three Colours: Blue, The English Patient, Chocolat.

name: Helen Mirren
quote: Perhaps the ultimate thinking man's sex symbol, she is renowned for delivering bold performances with an air of effortlessness that belies her extreme precision.
description: an English actress, one of the few performers who have achieved the Triple Crown of Acting. Some of her notable film roles include 2010 (1984), The Cook, the Thief, His Wife & Her Lover (1989), The Madness of King George (1994), Teaching Mrs. Tingle (1999), Gosford Park (2001).

name: Glenn Close
quote: When you look at the top 10 actresses of the past 80 years, since sound came in, Glenn Close is definitely in that list, it's a combination of her guts, in the roles she chooses, and her perseverance. There is no actor dead or alive as scary as a smiling Glenn Close.
description: an American actress, singer and film producer. Close has been consistently acclaimed for her versatility and is widely regarded as one of the finest actresses of her generation. Her films include: The Big Chill, The Natural, Fatal Attraction, and Dangerous Liaisons.

name: Jamie Lee Curtis
quote: Jamie Lee Curtis is an original scream queen whose career got off to a gory start.
